original: @118a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @118a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i k'a la tsakra mandalo pa yi k'a bi dhi:/
analyzed: shr'i k'a la tsakra mandalo pa yi k'a bi dhi:/
translated: śrī-kālacakra-maṇḍalopāyikā-vidhi

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo 'di dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga zhes bya ba /
translated: The glorious Kālacakra's Mandala Ritual, called The Procedure

original: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Kālacakra.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam par mkhyen pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rab tu 'joms par mdzad pa yi //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam par mkhyen pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rab tu 'joms par mdzad pa yi //
translated: By knowing the nature of both existence and nonexistence, you thoroughly conquer the fears of cyclic existence.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin khyab bdag dpal ldan dus 'khor des par gzhan gyi don mdzad la //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin khyab bdag dpal ldan dus 'khor des par gzhan gyi don mdzad la //
translated: To you, the glorious Kālacakra, the lord of all, whose nature is method and wisdom, who acts for the benefit of others,

original: phyag byas sems can don phyir rgyud gsungs cho ga bzhin du de yi dkyil 'khor cho ga nyid //
analyzed: phyag byas sems can don phyir rgyud gsungs cho ga bzhin du de yi dkyil 'khor cho ga nyid //
translated: I pay homage. For the sake of sentient beings, you taught the tantra and its ritual, and so I will explain the ritual of its mandala.

original: rang gi don dang 'on kyang gzhan don du yang 'gyur bas yid la 'dod pa sgrub byed bshad //
analyzed: rang gi don dang 'on kyang gzhan don du yang 'gyur bas yid la 'dod pa sgrub byed bshad //
translated: This will accomplish your wishes, both for your own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: 'dir thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa'i tshogs kyis blo'i mig bsgribs pas mi bden pa'i lam nas 'gro ba'i sems can gyi tshogs sdug bsngal spyod pa bsal bar nus par yang dag par mthong bas /
analyzed: 'dir thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa'i tshogs kyis blo'i mig bsgribs pas mi bden pa'i lam nas 'gro ba'i sems can gyi tshogs sdug bsngal spyod pa bsal bar nus par yang dag par mthong bas /
translated: Here, the assembly of sentient beings who travel on an unreal path due to the obscuration of the eye of the mind by the mass of the darkness of beginningless ignorance are seen to be capable of dispelling the experience of suffering.

original: snying rje mchog dang ldan pa mngon par shes pa thob pa'i dge slong ngam /
analyzed: snying rje mchog dang ldan pa mngon par shes pa thob pa'i dge slong ngam /
translated: Therefore, those who possess supreme compassion, whether they are fully ordained monks,

original: dge tshul lam khyim na gnas pa rnams snying rje dang ldan pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa med pa'i rdo rje slob dpon dang por bsnyen gnas kyi bslab pa gnas pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i @118b mya ngan las
analyzed: dge tshul lam khyim na gnas pa rnams snying rje dang ldan pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa med pa'i rdo rje slob dpon dang por bsnyen gnas kyi bslab pa gnas pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i @118b mya ngan las
translated: novices, or householders who have attained the higher perceptions, should first be initiated into the maṇḍala, and so on, by the vajra master who possesses compassion, and so on, but who does not have the higher perceptions.

original: 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyis de rnams kyi spobs pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su gzung ba ni /
analyzed: 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyis de rnams kyi spobs pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su gzung ba ni /
translated: Those who are to be guided should be guided by the path of entering the city of nirvāṇa according to their level of confidence.

original: de yang slob ma dam pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa dang / dge ba'i nyi ma la sogs pa la gtor ma dang / mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas /
analyzed: de yang slob ma dam pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa dang / dge ba'i nyi ma la sogs pa la gtor ma dang / mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas /
translated: Moreover, having previously made offerings, such as the sacrificial cake on an auspicious day,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: one should examine the site of the maṇḍala.

original: de yang grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbang ldan dang / byang phyogs su zhib dang rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbang ldan dang / byang phyogs su zhib dang rgyas pa'o //
translated: Further, in the north of a powerful place, such as a city, there is increase and prosperity.

original: shar dang me'i mtshams su dbye ba dang bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: shar dang me'i mtshams su dbye ba dang bskrad pa'o //
translated: In the east and southeast there is division and expulsion.

original: bden bral dang lho phyogs su dbang dang dgug pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral dang lho phyogs su dbang dang dgug pa'o //
translated: In the southwest and south there is power and attraction.

original: nub dang rlung du rengs pa dang rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: nub dang rlung du rengs pa dang rmongs pa'o //
translated: In the west and northwest there is paralysis and confusion.

original: grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbus su las thams cad pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbus su las thams cad pa'i dkyil 'khor bri ba ste /
translated: In the center of a city, one should draw the maṇḍala of all activities.

original: de yang dbus cung zad mtho ba la shar dang byang cung zad gzhol ba'i sa gzhi ru gzung bar bya ba ni de yang dbye ba la bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang dbus cung zad mtho ba la shar dang byang cung zad gzhol ba'i sa gzhi ru gzung bar bya ba ni de yang dbye ba la bzhi ste /
translated: Further, the site should be taken to be a place that is slightly higher in the center, and slightly lower in the east and north.

original: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams kyi dbye bas kha dog dang dri dang ro rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams kyi dbye bas kha dog dang dri dang ro rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The colors, smells, and tastes of the earth should be known by the divisions of the brahmin, kṣatriya, vaiśya, and śūdra castes.

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dkar po'o //🔽dbang dang dgug pa la dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa la dkar po'o // dbang dang dgug pa la dmar po'o //
translated: For pacifying and increasing, [use] white.🔽For controlling and summoning, [use] red.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ser po'o //
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la ser po'o //
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, [use] yellow.

original: gsad pa dang bskrad pa la nag po'o //
analyzed: gsad pa dang bskrad pa la nag po'o //
translated: For killing and expelling, [use] black.

original: ro thams cad dang / dri thams cad dang / nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa las thams cad pa la ljang gu'o //🔽der ni dong brus de nyid kyis //
analyzed: ro thams cad dang / dri thams cad dang / nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa las thams cad pa la ljang gu'o // der ni dong brus de nyid kyis //
translated: For all tastes and all smells, and for the purification of the element of space, [use] green.🔽There, dig a pit and fill it🔽with that very [earth]

original: myur bar dong nyid rab tu dgang //
analyzed: myur bar dong nyid rab tu dgang //
translated: quickly.

original: gal te gang bar gyur pa na //
analyzed: gal te gang bar gyur pa na //
translated: If it becomes full,

original: sa gzhi de nyid dge bar shes //
analyzed: sa gzhi de nyid dge bar shes //
translated: know that the ground is good.

original: slar yang dong de mtho gang tsam //
analyzed: slar yang dong de mtho gang tsam //
translated: Again, dig the pit one cubit

original: bru bar byas te chus bkang la //
analyzed: bru bar byas te chus bkang la //
translated: and fill it with water.🔽Walk one hundred steps

original: gom pa brgya ru 'gro bar bya //
analyzed: gom pa brgya ru 'gro bar bya //
translated: and return.

original: 'ongs nas blta bar byas pa dang // gang bar gyur na sa gzhi dge / dma' na dge bar mi 'dod spang //
analyzed: 'ongs nas blta bar byas pa dang // gang bar gyur na sa gzhi dge / dma' na dge bar mi 'dod spang //
translated: if it is low, it is not good, and should be abandoned.

original: chu nyid sgra dang bcas tsam gyis //
analyzed: chu nyid sgra dang bcas tsam gyis //
translated: By the sound of the water itself,

original: klu yi 'jigs sogs go bar bya //
analyzed: klu yi 'jigs sogs go bar bya //
translated: one should understand the fear of the nāgas, and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni sa gzhi brtags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa gzhi brtags pa'o //
translated: This is the examination of the ground.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis sa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya la //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis sa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya la //
translated: Thus, the master should know the characteristics of the ground.

original: dpyid zla 'bring po dang dpyid zla tha chungs sam /
analyzed: dpyid zla 'bring po dang dpyid zla tha chungs sam /
translated: In the middle month of spring or the last month of spring,

original: zla ba gzhan rnams kyi tshes lnga'am bcu la /
analyzed: zla ba gzhan rnams kyi tshes lnga'am bcu la /
translated: on the fifth or tenth day of any month,

original: gdug pa'i gza' la 'jug phod la sogs pa dang bral ba'i dus kyi snga dro la /
analyzed: gdug pa'i gza' la 'jug phod la sogs pa dang bral ba'i dus kyi snga dro la /
translated: in the morning of a time free from the entry of evil planets, and so forth,

original: khru bzhi tsam ba lang gi lci bas byugs te //
analyzed: khru bzhi tsam ba lang gi lci bas byugs te //
translated: having smeared [the ground] with cow dung the size of four cubits,

original: dkyil 'khor du brtags pa'i sa gzhi'i cha'i dbus su shar la kha phyogs te bsdad la lha'i rnal 'byor la gnas te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du brtags pa'i sa gzhi'i cha'i dbus su shar la kha phyogs te bsdad la lha'i rnal 'byor la gnas te /
translated: having sat in the center of the ground marked out for the maṇḍala, facing east, abiding in the yoga of the deity,

original: de na gnas pa'i zhing skyong rnams la me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i zhing skyong rnams la me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: having made offerings to the field protectors dwelling there with flowers and so forth,

original: 'di na gnas pa'i lha klu dang // gnod spyin @119a * //
analyzed: 'di na gnas pa'i lha klu dang // gnod spyin @119a * //
translated: yakṣas,

original: srin po'am ni gzhan //
analyzed: srin po'am ni gzhan //
translated: rākṣasas, or others,

original: de nyid rnams las gzhi slong //
analyzed: de nyid rnams las gzhi slong //
translated: demand the ground from those who are real.🔽Give it for the sake of the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor don du de stsol cig / ces lan gsum du brjod nas gsung bar 'gyur pa'i cho gas dag pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor don du de stsol cig / ces lan gsum du brjod nas gsung bar 'gyur pa'i cho gas dag pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: Having recited this three times, one should purify and so forth with the ritual of the speech.

original: grong gi ming dang sngags 'dis gtor ma sbyin no //
analyzed: grong gi ming dang sngags 'dis gtor ma sbyin no //
translated: One should give the bali with this mantra and the name of the village:

original: aom a'a:h'um aa mu ka sya sa pa ri w'a ra ya /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um aa mu ka sya sa pa ri w'a ra ya /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ to such and such a one with retinue

original: ai dam ba lim gandham /
analyzed: ai dam ba lim gandham /
translated: I offer this bali of perfume,🔽flowers,🔽incense,🔽lamps,

original: pushpam / dh'ugam /
analyzed: pushpam / dh'ugam /
translated: food, and drink,🔽greatly pleasing, with a delicious aroma, I summon.

original: d'ipam / aa ksha tam da ng'a ma hes pa'i w'a r'a:sh'i ghram a'a gtstshatu /
analyzed: d'ipam / aa ksha tam da ng'a ma hes pa'i w'a r'a:sh'i ghram a'a gtstshatu /
translated: jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ🔽Accept the bali, grant the oath,🔽protect the maṇḍala ground,🔽hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: dza:h'um bam ho:yi dam ba li grihna tu kh'a dam tu pi wa tus pa ri w'a r'a ka:sarba satv'a n'am sh'antim pushtim raksha aa war na gu ptim ka ro tu ai dam sthanam tya ka tva b'a hye mandala bhu my'am ti shthatu h'um h'um phat badzradh'ara a'adzny'a pa
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:yi dam ba li grihna tu kh'a dam tu pi wa tus pa ri w'a r'a ka:sarba satv'a n'am sh'antim pushtim raksha aa war na gu ptim ka ro tu ai dam sthanam tya ka tva b'a hye mandala bhu my'am ti shthatu h'um h'um phat badzradh'ara a'adzny'a pa
translated: vajra dhara ā jñāpa

original: ya ti s'a h'a /
analyzed: ya ti s'a h'a /
translated: YATISAHĀ.

original: zhes pa zhing skyong gshegs pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa zhing skyong gshegs pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the departure of the field-protector.

original: de nas sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i cho gas srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i cho gas srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms te /
translated: Then, having meditated on the protection wheel by the rite taught in the means of achievement,

original: bgegs bsreg pa dang bskrad pa dang gdab pa rnams byas pa dang / khro bo'i tshogs spros la phyogs bcu bsrungs nas sa'i lha mo spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bgegs bsreg pa dang bskrad pa dang gdab pa rnams byas pa dang / khro bo'i tshogs spros la phyogs bcu bsrungs nas sa'i lha mo spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: having performed the burning, expelling, and striking of the obstructors, and having guarded the ten directions by emanating a host of wrathful ones, one should invite the earth goddess.

original: de'i rim pa ni rang gi snying gar zla ba dangs gzhi la yang padma'i steng du zla ba la l'am yig yong su gyur pa las 'khor lo ser po'o //
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni rang gi snying gar zla ba dangs gzhi la yang padma'i steng du zla ba la l'am yig yong su gyur pa las 'khor lo ser po'o //
translated: The procedure is as follows: On a pure moon seat at one’s heart is a moon seat on a lotus, on which is a yaṃ syllable, which becomes a yellow wheel.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i lha mo zhal gsum phyag drug ma g-yas na 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang / rdo rje rnams 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i lha mo zhal gsum phyag drug ma g-yas na 'khor lo dang dbyug pa dang / rdo rje rnams 'dzin pa /
translated: That completely transforms into the earth goddess, with three faces, six arms, holding a wheel, a club, and a vajra in the right hands,

original: g-yon na dung dang / lcags sgrog dang / dril bu rnams 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon na dung dang / lcags sgrog dang / dril bu rnams 'dzin pa /
translated: and holding a conch, a chain, and a bell in the left hands.

original: na bza' ser po dang / rin po ches brgyan par bsams la /
analyzed: na bza' ser po dang / rin po ches brgyan par bsams la /
translated: She is imagined to be dressed in yellow garments and adorned with jewels.

original: thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sngon du gsungs pa'i gzugs ltar /
analyzed: thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sngon du gsungs pa'i gzugs ltar /
translated: Light rays from the seed syllable at the heart invoke the forms as previously described.

original: dza:h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sngags kyis spyan drangs te /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sngags kyis spyan drangs te /
translated: With the mantra “Jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” they are invited.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' gcig tu byas nas yon chab snod chu dang me tog dang / pril  sogs pa dang bcas pa'i yon chab dbul ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' gcig tu byas nas yon chab snod chu dang me tog dang / pril  sogs pa dang bcas pa'i yon chab dbul ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Having made the pledge beings into one, offer the water for welcoming and so on, with the water for the feet, flowers, and so on, reciting this praise:🔽When the lord of gods and the demon hordes were conquered by the Victor,

original: lha'i bdag po dang bcas bdud sde rgyal bas bcom dus lha mo khyod ni dbang du gyur pa'i tshe //
analyzed: lha'i bdag po dang bcas bdud sde rgyal bas bcom dus lha mo khyod ni dbang du gyur pa'i tshe //
translated: you, goddess, were brought under control.

original: khyed la lha mo mchog gi mchod dang phyag byas bzhes pa'i phyir ni de bzhin nga yi yon chab 'di yang bzhes //🔽zhes pas bstod la /
analyzed: khyed la lha mo mchog gi mchod dang phyag byas bzhes pa'i phyir ni de bzhin nga yi yon chab 'di yang bzhes // zhes pas bstod la /
translated: Therefore, goddess, accept this water for the feet, which is offered to you with the highest praise and homage.

original: byang chub rgyu ru stobs mchog ldan pa'i bdud kyi sde rnams rgyal bas bcom pa ji lta ba bzhin du //
analyzed: byang chub rgyu ru stobs mchog ldan pa'i bdud kyi sde rnams rgyal bas bcom pa ji lta ba bzhin du //
translated: Just as the Victor conquered the demon hordes, which possessed supreme power as the cause of awakening,

original: de bzhin bdag kyang slob ma rnams kyi dbang gi don du bdud kyi stobs rnams 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag kyang slob ma rnams kyi dbang gi don du bdud kyi stobs rnams 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: in the same way, I will destroy the forces of the māras for the sake of the disciples’ empowerment.

original: zhes pas gsol ba btab la sngags 'dis mchod do //
analyzed: zhes pas gsol ba btab la sngags 'dis mchod do //
translated: Having supplicated with that, make offerings with this mantra.

original: aom l'am a'a:h'um basundhari sarba buddha dzny'ana ni sarba @119b satvo pa k'a ri ni badzra satva a'a dznya pa ya ti sh'i ghram a'a gtstsha a'a gatstsha yi dam gandham /
analyzed: aom l'am a'a:h'um basundhari sarba buddha dzny'ana ni sarba @119b satvo pa k'a ri ni badzra satva a'a dznya pa ya ti sh'i ghram a'a gtstsha a'a gatstsha yi dam gandham /
translated: oṃ laṃ āḥ hūṃ sundharī sarva buddha jñāna ni sarva sattva upakāriṇi vajra sattva ā jñāpaya śighram āgacchā āgacchā yadā gandham

original: pushpam / dh'upam /🔽d'ibam / nee be dyam pha la aa ksha tam /
analyzed: pushpam / dh'upam / d'ibam / nee be dyam pha la aa ksha tam /
translated: puṣpam dhūpam🔽dīpam naivedyam apāca sthānam

original: da d'a mi t'a wa tva me wa grihna grihna mandala aar tham ma ma sth'a n'am da d'a sarba satv'an'am /
analyzed: da d'a mi t'a wa tva me wa grihna grihna mandala aar tham ma ma sth'a n'am da d'a sarba satv'an'am /
translated: dadāmi tava me va grahaṇa grahaṇa maṇḍala artham mama sthānam dadā sarva sattvānām

original: sh'antim pushtim kritva su bha tsi tte na ai dam sth'a n'a gatstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sh'antim pushtim kritva su bha tsi tte na ai dam sth'a n'a gatstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: śāntiṃ puṣṭiṃ kṛtvā subhacittena idam sthānam āgacchā svāhā.

original: zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo gshegs su gsol ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo gshegs su gsol ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for requesting the earth goddess to depart.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phyogs bcu nam mkha'i khams khyad par bltas la yon chab la sogs pa byin nas me tog la sogs pas mchod la /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phyogs bcu nam mkha'i khams khyad par bltas la yon chab la sogs pa byin nas me tog la sogs pas mchod la /
translated: Then, having invited the buddhas and bodhisattvas to the space of the ten directions, make offerings with water for the feet and so on, and with flowers and so forth.

original: de rnams la rab tu gsol ba gdab pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de rnams la rab tu gsol ba gdab pa 'di lta ste /
translated: One should make a very strong request to them, as follows:

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang sdig pa bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' phyogs rnams la bzhugs gang dag btsun mor bcas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang sdig pa bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' phyogs rnams la bzhugs gang dag btsun mor bcas //
translated: The Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas, who are free from sin, who dwell in the directions, together with their queens,

original: snying rje mchog ldan de nyid rnams kyis bdag la dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur don du bskyab tu gsol //🔽zhes pas so //
analyzed: snying rje mchog ldan de nyid rnams kyis bdag la dkyil 'khor du ni dbang bskur don du bskyab tu gsol // zhes pas so //
translated: who have supreme compassion, may they protect me, so that I may be empowered into the mandala.

original: de nas bgegs dang log par 'dren pa la sogs pa gzhan rnams rdo rje lcags kyus dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bgegs dang log par 'dren pa la sogs pa gzhan rnams rdo rje lcags kyus dgug par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should summon the obstructors, the misleaders, and so forth, with the vajra hook.

original: rdo rje zhags pas bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhags pas bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind them with the vajra noose.

original: rdo rje phur bu khro bo'i rgyal po'i lte ba man chad mdung gi rnam pa can du sdang ba rnams kyi steng nas 'debs par bsams pa'i sngags kyi rkang pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phur bu khro bo'i rgyal po'i lte ba man chad mdung gi rnam pa can du sdang ba rnams kyi steng nas 'debs par bsams pa'i sngags kyi rkang pa 'di lta ste /
translated: One should imagine that the lower part of the wrathful king Vajrakīla is in the form of a spear, and that it is thrust down upon the enemies. The mantra syllables are as follows:

original: seng ldeng las byung bas phur ba chur sor bcu gnyis pa sboms su sor bzhi pas sa gzhi'i phyogs bcu ru gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ldeng las byung bas phur ba chur sor bcu gnyis pa sboms su sor bzhi pas sa gzhi'i phyogs bcu ru gdab par bya'o //
translated: Since it is made of acacia wood, it is twelve fingerbreadths long and four fingerbreadths thick.

original: de rnams la khro bo rang rang gi mtshon cha dang bcas pa bcu spros la dgod do ;
analyzed: de rnams la khro bo rang rang gi mtshon cha dang bcas pa bcu spros la dgod do ;
translated: One should imagine that the ten wrathful ones emanate from oneself and are placed on those stakes.

original: /'di ni sa gzhi phur bus bsrung ba'i don du bgegs rnams la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: /'di ni sa gzhi phur bus bsrung ba'i don du bgegs rnams la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of striking the obstructors with stakes in order to protect the ground with stakes.

original: de nas de ltar bgegs med par bsams la lto 'phye ba brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de ltar bgegs med par bsams la lto 'phye ba brtag par bya ste /
translated: Then, thinking that there are no obstructors, one should examine the ground.

original: dkyil 'khor gang du byed pa'i sa gzhi der sa stegs gru bzhi pa byas la /🔽sa gzhi de nyid kyi dbus su lho 'phye nyal ba la @120a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang du byed pa'i sa gzhi der sa stegs gru bzhi pa byas la / sa gzhi de nyid kyi dbus su lho 'phye nyal ba la @120a * //
translated: One should make a square platform on the ground where the maṇḍala will be made.

original: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas la sa gzhi dag par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas la sa gzhi dag par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that ground, one should know the characteristics of the sleeping tortoise, and so on, and purify the ground.

original: de yang nyi ma bgrod pa'i dbye bas ston zla ra ba la sogs pa zla ba gsum gsum rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang nyi ma bgrod pa'i dbye bas ston zla ra ba la sogs pa zla ba gsum gsum rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, in each of the three months of the first autumn month, and so on, according to the division of the sun’s path,

original: shar dang / lho dang nub dang / byang gi phyogs rnams su mgo bstan nas lho la sogs par kha bltas pa ste sa gzhi de'i dbus su lto 'phye nyal zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang nub dang / byang gi phyogs rnams su mgo bstan nas lho la sogs par kha bltas pa ste sa gzhi de'i dbus su lto 'phye nyal zhes bshad pas so //
translated: The directions are east, south, west, and north. Sleeping like a sea monster means lying down in the middle of the ground, facing south, etc.

original: de ltar shes par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar shes par byas la /
translated: Having understood it in this way,

original: byang phyogs kyi sgrub pa po dang thabs cig tu rdo rje khu tshur gyis skud pa bzung ste /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi sgrub pa po dang thabs cig tu rdo rje khu tshur gyis skud pa bzung ste /
translated: the practitioner of the northern direction, together with the vajra fist,🔽should hold the thread, and, remaining in the southeast and southwest,

original: me dang rlung du gnas nas shar dang lho dang / byang dang / nub kyi phyogs dag tu g-yas skor gyis 'gro zhing thig pa rkang ngo //
analyzed: me dang rlung du gnas nas shar dang lho dang / byang dang / nub kyi phyogs dag tu g-yas skor gyis 'gro zhing thig pa rkang ngo //
translated: moving in the east, south, north, and west directions, in a clockwise direction, he should lay down the thread.

original: yang de ltar bskor zhing sa brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang de ltar bskor zhing sa brko bar bya'o //
translated: Again, he should dig the ground in that way.

original: lto 'phye'i lte ba'i phyogs nas te lto ba las khru gang spangs pa'am lte ba'i thad so spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lto 'phye'i lte ba'i phyogs nas te lto ba las khru gang spangs pa'am lte ba'i thad so spangs pa'o //
translated: From the navel of the sea monster, that is, one cubit away from the navel, or at the level of the navel.

original: sa gzhi de nyid la rdo ba gnas na rlung gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //🔽rus pas ni gzer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi de nyid la rdo ba gnas na rlung gis 'jig par 'gyur ro // rus pas ni gzer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a stone in that ground, it will destroy the wind.🔽If there is bone, it will cause pain.

original: gyo mo dag gis ni lkug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyo mo dag gis ni lkug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are pebbles, it will cause dumbness.

original: sbun pa dang sol bdag gis ni rims sam 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbun pa dang sol bdag gis ni rims sam 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the husks and ashes are seen, there will be a fever or death.

original: skra dang rtsva dang thal ba dang shing bu la sogs pa rnams kyis ni bar chod phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skra dang rtsva dang thal ba dang shing bu la sogs pa rnams kyis ni bar chod phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If the hair, grass, ashes, sticks, and so on are seen, there will be a minor obstacle.

original: rgyu mtshan des na de rnams dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan des na de rnams dor bar bya'o //
translated: For that reason, they should be discarded.

original: gal te de nas rin po che'am dung ngam 'ching bu rnams byung na shin tu dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de nas rin po che'am dung ngam 'ching bu rnams byung na shin tu dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a jewel, conch, or amulet is seen, it is very auspicious.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sa gzhi ma rnyed na chu 'am rdo mthong ba'i bar du brkos las de rnams dor te /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sa gzhi ma rnyed na chu 'am rdo mthong ba'i bar du brkos las de rnams dor te /
translated: If one does not find a site with the characteristics previously mentioned, one should dig until one sees water or a stone. Discarding those,

original: sa gzhan gyis dgang ba ni dri dang ro'i don du las kyi bye brag gis sa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: sa gzhan gyis dgang ba ni dri dang ro'i don du las kyi bye brag gis sa'i bye brag ste /
translated: one should fill the hole with other earth, for the sake of smell and taste, with different kinds of earth according to the particular rite.

original: sa dkar po la tsandan gyi chu dang bska ba dang kha ba dag gis bsres pas dgang ngo //
analyzed: sa dkar po la tsandan gyi chu dang bska ba dang kha ba dag gis bsres pas dgang ngo //
translated: One should fill the white earth with water mixed with sandalwood, astringent and sour substances.

original: dmar po la padma'i chu dang tsha ba gsum gyis so //
analyzed: dmar po la padma'i chu dang tsha ba gsum gyis so //
translated: For the red earth, one should use water mixed with lotus and the three pungent roots.

original: ser po la bong bu dang rta dang mi rnams kyi gcin dang bu ram gyis so //
analyzed: ser po la bong bu dang rta dang mi rnams kyi gcin dang bu ram gyis so //
translated: For yellow, use the urine of a donkey, a horse, and a human, and molasses.

original: nag po la sha rul dang lan tshva dang skyur ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nag po la sha rul dang lan tshva dang skyur ba rnams kyis so //
translated: For black, use rotten meat, salt, and sour substances.

original: de nas dkar por zhi ba las gzhi'i snying por shel gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkar por zhi ba las gzhi'i snying por shel gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, for white, place crystal in the heart of the base for pacifying.

original: rgyas pa la dung ngo //
analyzed: rgyas pa la dung ngo //
translated: For increasing, use a conch.

original: rims gzhom pa la mu tig go //
analyzed: rims gzhom pa la mu tig go //
translated: For overcoming contagious diseases, use a pearl.

original: dmar po dbang du bya ba la go ro tsa na'o //
analyzed: dmar po dbang du bya ba la go ro tsa na'o //
translated: For red, use gośīrṣa sandalwood for enthralling.

original: dgug pa la mtshal lo //
analyzed: dgug pa la mtshal lo //
translated: For summoning, use madder.

original: dug rengs pa la ldong ros so //
analyzed: dug rengs pa la ldong ros so //
translated: For paralyzing poison, use realgar.

original: ser po phur bus gdab pa la lug gi rva'o //🔽rengs pa la ba bla'o //
analyzed: ser po phur bus gdab pa la lug gi rva'o // rengs pa la ba bla'o //
translated: For yellow, use a sheep’s horn for the rite of stabbing.🔽For paralyzing, use barley.

original: rmongs pa la sbrul lo //
analyzed: rmongs pa la sbrul lo //
translated: For stupefying, use a snake.

original: nag por gsad pa la mi'i rus pa'o //
analyzed: nag por gsad pa la mi'i rus pa'o //
translated: For black, use human bone for killing.

original: bskrad pa la bya rog gi sgro'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa la bya rog gi sgro'o //
translated: For banishing, use a crow’s feather.

original: ljang gur ni rin po che lnga rnams gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: ljang gur ni rin po che lnga rnams gzhug pa'o //
translated: For green, place the five precious substances.

original: de nas dpangs la khru phyed dang do pa kun du mnyam pa cung zad rus sbal gyi rgyab 'dra @120b ba shar dang byang gzhol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi bca'o //
analyzed: de nas dpangs la khru phyed dang do pa kun du mnyam pa cung zad rus sbal gyi rgyab 'dra @120b ba shar dang byang gzhol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi bca'o //
translated: Then, the ground of the maṇḍala should be made level, with a height of one cubit and four finger lengths, and slightly sloping toward the north and east, like the back of a turtle.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa /🔽ro yi skyon rnams ma lus pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa / ro yi skyon rnams ma lus pa //
translated: Moreover, it is said:🔽If it is not possible to remove

original: dbyung bar nus par ma gyur na //
analyzed: dbyung bar nus par ma gyur na //
translated: all the faults of the corpse,

original: lag pas mnan la sngags nyid bzlas //
analyzed: lag pas mnan la sngags nyid bzlas //
translated: press it with one’s hand and recite the mantra.

original: de nyid dag pa chen por bshad //
analyzed: de nyid dag pa chen por bshad //
translated: That is explained as the great purification.

original: khang bzangs rdo steng 'brog dang lam //
analyzed: khang bzangs rdo steng 'brog dang lam //
translated: In a house, on a stone, in a wilderness, on a road,🔽in a temple, and so on, on a riverbank,

original: lhag khang la sogs chu 'gram dang / sngon du dag par byas pa rnams //
analyzed: lhag khang la sogs chu 'gram dang / sngon du dag par byas pa rnams //
translated: those previously purified

original: ma sbyangs pa nas dag pa yin //
analyzed: ma sbyangs pa nas dag pa yin //
translated: are purified from the unpurified.

original: zhes gsungs pas 'on kyang rdo rje shugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis 'dir bgegs bskrad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'on kyang rdo rje shugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis 'dir bgegs bskrad pa ni /
translated: However, the obstructors here are expelled by the yoga of vajra speed.

original: yi ge bdun pa bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba rnams kyis bsnun pa dang / shar nas brtsams nas rnams lngas sa gzhi la byugs te bcal la yang sbyang ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yi ge bdun pa bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba rnams kyis bsnun pa dang / shar nas brtsams nas rnams lngas sa gzhi la byugs te bcal la yang sbyang ba 'di lta ste /
translated: One should strike with mustard seed, water, and ashes that have been enchanted with the recitation of the seven-syllable mantra, and one should anoint the ground with the five [substances] beginning with the east.🔽One should purify the area with this [mantra]:

original: aom bhu: kham zhes brjod la nam mkhar bya'o //
analyzed: aom bhu: kham zhes brjod la nam mkhar bya'o //
translated: Om bhūḥ kham.

original: de nas h'um l'am h'um zhes pas rdo rje'i sa gzhir bsams la /
analyzed: de nas h'um l'am h'um zhes pas rdo rje'i sa gzhir bsams la /
translated: Then, with “hum la hum,” one should imagine the ground as a vajra.

original: aom me di n'i badzr'a bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
analyzed: aom me di n'i badzr'a bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
translated: Om medini vajra bhava vajra bandha hum.

original: aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ha na ha na badzra kro dha h'um phat /
translated: Om hana hana vajra krodha hum phat.

original: aom a'a: h'um sho dha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um sho dha ya sho dha ya raksha raksha h'um h'um phat /
translated: Om aḥ hum śodhaya śodhaya rakṣa rakṣa hum hum phat.

original: ces pa'i sngags brjod cing /
analyzed: ces pa'i sngags brjod cing /
translated: Reciting this mantra,

original: thal mos la bzhag la byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: thal mos la bzhag la byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: one should bless the ground with one’s palms.

original: de nas sngon du gnas gzhan du gshegs pa'i sa'i lha mo yid kyis spyan drangs la gtor ma dang zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas sngon du gnas gzhan du gshegs pa'i sa'i lha mo yid kyis spyan drangs la gtor ma dang zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: Then, having invited the earth goddess who previously departed to another place, one should worship her with a bali offering, washing the feet, and so forth.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho ham ksha: zhes pa brjod la padma'i lag skor byas pa dang / de nyid du thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho ham ksha: zhes pa brjod la padma'i lag skor byas pa dang / de nyid du thim par bsam mo //
translated: Reciting Om āḥ hūṃ ho haṃ kṣaḥ, one should make a lotus hand-circle and imagine that [the deities] dissolve into that very [ground].

original: de nas rkang pa bcu drug pa'i sngags brjod pa dang khams gsum po stong par ro gcig par brtan par nges pa sa gzhi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de nyid du lhag par mos par bya ba 'di ni gang na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rkang pa bcu drug pa'i sngags brjod pa dang khams gsum po stong par ro gcig par brtan par nges pa sa gzhi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de nyid du lhag par mos par bya ba 'di ni gang na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Then, reciting the sixteen-part mantra, one should imagine that the three realms are of one taste in emptiness, and that the ground is purified and stabilized in that very [ground]. This is the purification of the ground that is nowhere else.

original: de nas me tog gi phreng ba sna tshogs pa dril bu dang bcas pa dang / na bza' sna tshogs dang bla re rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi thams cad legs par brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas me tog gi phreng ba sna tshogs pa dril bu dang bcas pa dang / na bza' sna tshogs dang bla re rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi thams cad legs par brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Then, with various flower garlands, bells, and various garments and canopies, one should adorn the entire ground of the maṇḍala.

original: 'di ni sa sbyang ba'i bye brag gsum gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sa sbyang ba'i bye brag gsum gyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure of the three purifications of the ground.

original: de nas me tog gis spras pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i dbus su bsdad la rdo rje dang / rdo rje dril bu bzung nas bri bya'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bgegs rnams brlag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas me tog gis spras pa'i dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i dbus su bsdad la rdo rje dang / rdo rje dril bu bzung nas bri bya'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas srung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bgegs rnams brlag par bya ba ni /
translated: Then, sitting in the center of the mandala adorned with flowers, holding the vajra and bell, endowed with the yoga of the mandala to be drawn, one should destroy the obstructors with the protection wheel and so forth.

original: spos snod bzung ste /
analyzed: spos snod bzung ste /
translated: Holding the incense burner,

original: lce h'um las rdo rjer bskyed nas brjod pa /🔽phyogs rnams kun na bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: lce h'um las rdo rjer bskyed nas brjod pa / phyogs rnams kun na bzhugs pa yi //
translated: one should generate the tongue as a vajra from hūṃ and recite:🔽All buddhas dwelling in the directions,

original: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
translated: please heed me.🔽Here, I, [name], vajra master,

original: 'dir ni che ge rdo rje bdag / dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni che ge rdo rje bdag / dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pa yi //
translated: wish to draw the maṇḍala.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs byon par zhu //🔽'di ni dngos grub rab tu stsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs byon par zhu // 'di ni dngos grub rab tu stsol //
translated: I request the buddhas and so forth to come.

original: zhes @121a * //
analyzed: zhes @121a * //
translated: This is the bestower of spiritual powers.

analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis rdo rje dril bu bzung la /

analyzed: don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor rim pa bzhin du de dang de ru 'gro zhing /

original: sems dpa' kun las sems chen po //
analyzed: sems dpa' kun las sems chen po //
translated: The great mind of all the bodhisattvas,

original: rang bzhin dag pas dri ma med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas dri ma med //
translated: stainless with pure nature,🔽Samantabhadra, the supreme mind,

original: kun du bzang po thugs kyi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po thugs kyi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: de bzhin gshegs kun rang bzhin bral //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kun rang bzhin bral //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: the abode of all tathāgatas,🔽the supreme selflessness of all phenomena,
