analyzed: chos kun bdag med pa yi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.🔽The supreme arising from the peace of phenomena,

original: chos rnams zhi ba las byung mchog / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes spyod //
analyzed: chos rnams zhi ba las byung mchog / rnam par dag pa'i ye shes spyod //
translated: the conduct of pure gnosis,🔽Samantabhadra, the supreme speech,

original: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs //
translated: The perfection of all characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid bral ba rnam par spangs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bral ba rnam par spangs //
translated: free from the characteristics of abandonment,

original: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog /
analyzed: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog /
translated: Samantabhadra, the supreme body,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the sacred mandala.

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'i rim pa bzhin bdag nyid kyis gsol ba 'debs su gzhug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'i rim pa bzhin bdag nyid kyis gsol ba 'debs su gzhug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should have them recite the four verses in order, beginning with the supplication.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te mdzub mo sgreng ba rtse mo sprad pa 'og tu phyogs pas spyi bor bzhag la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas bsgoms pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te mdzub mo sgreng ba rtse mo sprad pa 'og tu phyogs pas spyi bor bzhag la /
translated: Then, having previously emanated the wheel of the mandala and so on, one should bind the two vajra fists and extend the index fingers, touching the tips together, and place it below, on the crown,

original: h'um badzra au ti shtha /
analyzed: h'um badzra au ti shtha /
translated: reciting hūṃ vajro’tsthāna.

original: zhes bya ba brjod de nam mkha' la gdeg go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod de nam mkha' la gdeg go //
translated: One should lift it up into space.

original: skyil mo krung bkrol te langs nas shar du phyogs pa dang mnyam par bsdad la /
analyzed: skyil mo krung bkrol te langs nas shar du phyogs pa dang mnyam par bsdad la /
translated: Unbinding the crossed legs, one should stand up and sit in the full lotus posture, facing east.

original: thal mo spyi bor sbyar la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag byas pa dang / sems can rnams ma rig pa'i mun par lhung ba bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa mthong nas bdud de rnams brlag par bya ba'i don du skad cig gis rdo rje shugs kyi sku khro gnyer dang mche ba gtsigs pa dang ldan par byas nas mig g-yas par ma
analyzed: thal mo spyi bor sbyar la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag byas pa dang / sems can rnams ma rig pa'i mun par lhung ba bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa mthong nas bdud de rnams brlag par bya ba'i don du skad cig gis rdo rje shugs kyi sku khro gnyer dang mche ba gtsigs pa dang ldan par byas nas mig g-yas par ma
translated: Having joined the palms at the crown of the head and paid homage to the tathāgatas, seeing that sentient beings have fallen into the darkness of ignorance and are possessed by demons, in order to destroy those demons, in an instant one should assume the body of Vajravega, endowed with frowns and bared fangs, and with the syllable maṃ in the right eye,

original: las nyi ma dang g-yon par ta las zla ba dang mig 'bras la h'um las dus mtha'i me dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rdo rje'i lta stangs 'dir phyogs thams cad kyi 'gro bar bltas la /
analyzed: las nyi ma dang g-yon par ta las zla ba dang mig 'bras la h'um las dus mtha'i me dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rdo rje'i lta stangs 'dir phyogs thams cad kyi 'gro bar bltas la /
translated: the sun, and in the left eye, the moon from taṃ, and in the eyeballs, hūṃ, endowed with the fire at the end of time, one should look at the beings in all directions with this vajra gaze.

original: nga rgyal bskyed pa ni /🔽bdag ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed pa ni / bdag ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Generating pride:🔽I am the glorious Vajradhara.

original: bdag nyid rdo rje shugs nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje shugs nyid do //
translated: I am the very Vajravega.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
translated: I am the great king of buddhas.

original: bdag ni stobs chen rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bdag ni stobs chen rdo rje'o //
translated: I am the powerful vajra.

original: bdag ni rnal 'byor dbang po'i rgyal //
analyzed: bdag ni rnal 'byor dbang po'i rgyal //
translated: I am the king of the lords of yoga.

original: bdag ni phyag rgya rdo rje bstan //🔽@121b zhes bas so //
analyzed: bdag ni phyag rgya rdo rje bstan // @121b zhes bas so //
translated: I am Vajra Seal.

original: de nas rkang mthil du 'bar bzhin pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la gsung bar 'gyur ba'i rim pas bgyid pa dang bcas pa'i padma'i lag skor bya /
analyzed: de nas rkang mthil du 'bar bzhin pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la gsung bar 'gyur ba'i rim pas bgyid pa dang bcas pa'i padma'i lag skor bya /
translated: Then, having meditated on a blazing vajra on the soles of the feet, one should circle the lotus of the speech-goddess with the sequence of the recitation, together with the performance.

original: rdo rje gsor dril bu dkrol zhing dbang ldan nas brtsams te g-yas skor gyis rdo rje'i 'gros kyis bcag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje gsor dril bu dkrol zhing dbang ldan nas brtsams te g-yas skor gyis rdo rje'i 'gros kyis bcag par bya ba ni /
translated: Waving the vajra and ringing the bell, one should break the enclosure with the vajra dance, beginning from the northeast and circling to the right.

original: slob ma dang bcas sam gcig pus dkyil 'khor gyis gzhil gar bya ba ste /
analyzed: slob ma dang bcas sam gcig pus dkyil 'khor gyis gzhil gar bya ba ste /
translated: Either together with the disciples or alone, one should dance on the mandala base.

original: mig dag lag dag dpyi dag dang // rkang rtsibs logs kyis g-yas skor bya //
analyzed: mig dag lag dag dpyi dag dang // rkang rtsibs logs kyis g-yas skor bya //
translated: Eyes, hands, hips, and the soles of the feet should circle to the right.

original: mdangs dang brjid kyis sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: mdangs dang brjid kyis sbyor ba yis //
translated: With radiance and splendor,

original: g-yas min pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yas min pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: the left is also like that.

original: de ltar rgyun gyis gar byas nas //
analyzed: de ltar rgyun gyis gar byas nas //
translated: Having danced in that way continuously,

original: bsdus te bskor byas de nas yang //
analyzed: bsdus te bskor byas de nas yang //
translated: gather and circle, and then again

original: myur ba'i brjid kyis de bzhin gar ;
analyzed: myur ba'i brjid kyis de bzhin gar ;
translated: dance like that with swift splendor,

original: / bya zhing gtso bo'i gzugs kyis bskor //
analyzed: / bya zhing gtso bo'i gzugs kyis bskor //
translated: circling with the form of the principal deity.

original: lus ngag yid rnams brtan gnas pas //
analyzed: lus ngag yid rnams brtan gnas pas //
translated: With body, speech, and mind stable,

original: gson cig bgegs kyi tshogs rnams kun //
analyzed: gson cig bgegs kyi tshogs rnams kun //
translated: Listen, all you hosts of obstructors!

original: dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin bdag gis //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin bdag gis //
translated: The glorious Vajradhara

original: bka' stsal bzhin du mi byed na //
analyzed: bka' stsal bzhin du mi byed na //
translated: will destroy you if you do not act in accordance with his command.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba 'di yis ni //
translated: This blazing vajra

original: rigs gsum las byung 'joms par byed //
analyzed: rigs gsum las byung 'joms par byed //
translated: will destroy you, born from the three families.

original: gal te bdag gi bka' 'das na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi bka' 'das na //
translated: If you transgress my command,

original: rnam par rlag 'gyur gzhan du min //
analyzed: rnam par rlag 'gyur gzhan du min //
translated: you will be destroyed, not otherwise.

original: zhes pa lan gsum brjod cing khro bo dpag tu med pa spros la bgegs rnams bcom ste /
analyzed: zhes pa lan gsum brjod cing khro bo dpag tu med pa spros la bgegs rnams bcom ste /
translated: Recite this three times, emanate immeasurable wrathful ones, destroy the obstructors,

original: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i 'og gi bar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi'i 'og gi bar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: and bless the ground of the maṇḍala as the nature of vajras arisen from hūṃs.

original: 'dir 'chag pa'i dus su so so bdag nyid kyi g-yon na gnas pa'i dril bu'i nang du bdag nyid kyi rdo rje gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'chag pa'i dus su so so bdag nyid kyi g-yon na gnas pa'i dril bu'i nang du bdag nyid kyi rdo rje gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Here, when walking, one should insert one’s vajra into the bell held in one’s left hand.

original: de'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi g-yon gyi dril bu ru'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi g-yon gyi dril bu ru'o //
translated: One’s vajra, the nature of the bell, is in the left.

original: de bzhin du mdun dang g-yas dang rgyab rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdun dang g-yas dang rgyab rnams la yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, in front, to the right, and behind.

original: de nas h'um h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rkang pa'i 'og tu rnam par bsams la rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas rkang pa'i mthil du reg ste /
analyzed: de nas h'um h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rkang pa'i 'og tu rnam par bsams la rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas rkang pa'i mthil du reg ste /
translated: Then, having visualized a five-pronged vajra arisen from hūṃ hūṃ under the feet, touch the soles of the feet with the five-pronged vajra mudra.

original: rkang pa'i mthil gyi rdo rje des sa gzhi'i dbus su bcag pa ni /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil gyi rdo rje des sa gzhi'i dbus su bcag pa ni /
translated: With that vajra on the soles of the feet, break through the center of the ground.

original: g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang dang mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis yongs su bskor ro //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang dang mnyam pa'i rkang stabs kyis yongs su bskor ro //
translated: Encircle with the right leg extended, the left leg extended, and the legs even.

original: rkang mthil du yam y'a /🔽bkod la ral gri'i phyag rgyas reg ste shar du zlum po'i 'dug stangs kyis so //
analyzed: rkang mthil du yam y'a / bkod la ral gri'i phyag rgyas reg ste shar du zlum po'i 'dug stangs kyis so //
translated: Arrange yaṃ yaṃ on the soles of the feet,🔽touch with the sword mudra, and in the east, with the round sitting posture.

original: ram r'a: bkod la rin po che'i phyag rgyas reg ste lho ru rol pas so //
analyzed: ram r'a: bkod la rin po che'i phyag rgyas reg ste lho ru rol pas so //
translated: Arrange raṃ rā, touch with the jewel mudra, and in the south, with the reclining posture.

original: lam l'a: bkod la 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas reg ste nub tu sa ga'o //
analyzed: lam l'a: bkod la 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas reg ste nub tu sa ga'o //
translated: Arrange laṃ lā, touch with the wheel mudra, and in the west, with the square.

original: wam w'a: bkod la padma'i phyag rgyas reg ste byang du padma'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bcag pa'o //
analyzed: wam w'a: bkod la padma'i phyag rgyas reg ste byang du padma'i 'dug stangs kyis byin gyis brlabs nas bcag pa'o //
translated: Arrange vaṃ vā, touch with the lotus mudra, and in the north, with the lotus sitting posture.

original: de yang lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar bar byas te mthe bong dag sbyar te de ltar mthe'u chung dag kyang ngo //🔽gung mo dag steng @122a * //
analyzed: de yang lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar bar byas te mthe bong dag sbyar te de ltar mthe'u chung dag kyang ngo // gung mo dag steng @122a * //
translated: The two hands are joined in añjali, with the thumbs joined and the little fingers also joined.🔽The middle fingers are on top means that the middle fingers are joined together.

original: du sbyar nas de dag gi rgyab tu mdzub mo gnyis zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par dgug go //
analyzed: du sbyar nas de dag gi rgyab tu mdzub mo gnyis zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par dgug go //
translated: The two index fingers are bent behind them in the shape of a half-moon.

original: srin lag gnyis rang rang gi lag mthil du son pa 'di ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: srin lag gnyis rang rang gi lag mthil du son pa 'di ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two ring fingers reach the palms of their respective hands is the mudra of the five-pronged vajra.

original: rdo rje khu tshur bcings te gung mo dang mdzub mo sbyar te sgreng ba ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur bcings te gung mo dang mdzub mo sbyar te sgreng ba ral gri'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The vajra fist is clenched, and the middle finger and index finger are joined and extended. This is the sword mudra.

original: sor mo lnga sbyar te gung mo dbus nas steng du cung zad phyung ba rin po che'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo lnga sbyar te gung mo dbus nas steng du cung zad phyung ba rin po che'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The five fingers are joined, and the middle finger is slightly extended from the center is the jewel mudra.

original: sor mo rnams 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi rnam par brkyang ba 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo rnams 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi rnam par brkyang ba 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The fingers are extended in the shape of the spokes of a wheel. This is the wheel mudra.

original: mthe bong dang mthe'u chung sbyar te lhag ma rnams brkyang ba padma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe bong dang mthe'u chung sbyar te lhag ma rnams brkyang ba padma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The thumbs and little fingers are joined, and the remaining fingers are extended is the lotus mudra.

original: de nas rkang pa g-yon pa bskum ste rkang pa g-yas pa mtho lnga ru brkyang nas rol pas drang por gnas pa 'di ni g-yas brkyang ngo //
analyzed: de nas rkang pa g-yon pa bskum ste rkang pa g-yas pa mtho lnga ru brkyang nas rol pas drang por gnas pa 'di ni g-yas brkyang ngo //
translated: Then, bending the left leg and extending the right leg five cubits, standing straight with ease, this is right-extended.

original: de las zlog pa ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
analyzed: de las zlog pa ni g-yon brkyang ngo //
translated: The opposite of that is left-extended.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo rnams mnyam par gnas pa mnyam pa'i 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi sor mo rnams mnyam par gnas pa mnyam pa'i 'dug stangs so //
translated: The even posture is the even placement of the toes of both legs.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi bar la sor mo nyi shu rtsa drug dang ldan pas pus mo ya gcig gyen du cung zad bkan pas rol pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi bar la sor mo nyi shu rtsa drug dang ldan pas pus mo ya gcig gyen du cung zad bkan pas rol pa'o //
translated: With twenty-six toes between both legs, slightly bending one knee upward is ease.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyi bar la sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyi bar la sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang ldan pas /
translated: With twenty-four toes between both legs,

original: pus mo gnyis rgyab tu cung zad bkan pa sa ga'o //
analyzed: pus mo gnyis rgyab tu cung zad bkan pa sa ga'o //
translated: slightly bending both knees backward is earth.

original: sa ga las ngang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas te bar la khru do byas pa zlum po'o //
analyzed: sa ga las ngang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas te bar la khru do byas pa zlum po'o //
translated: From earth, like the wings of a goose, making a circle one cubit in diameter is round.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi la dri yis byugs la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi la dri yis byugs la /
translated: Then, having anointed the maṇḍala base with scent,

original: badzra gandha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang pas yang dag par mchod do //
analyzed: badzra gandha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang pas yang dag par mchod do //
translated: one should make perfect offerings with the mantra line, “oṃ vajra gandhe…,” and so on.

original: yang sngon gyi cho gar gsungs pa ltar rdo rje sa'i lha mo spyan drang ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: yang sngon gyi cho gar gsungs pa ltar rdo rje sa'i lha mo spyan drang ba'i sngags ni /
translated: Also, according to the ancient ritual texts, the mantra for inviting the goddess of the earth is:

original: aom l'am h'um badzra bh'u mi tishtha ma tsal h'um h'um phat badzra dh'a ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom l'am h'um badzra bh'u mi tishtha ma tsal h'um h'um phat badzra dh'a ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ laṃ hūṃ. Vajra earth, be firm. Do not shake. Hūṃ hūṃ. Phaṭ. The vajra ground is made firm. Svāhā.

original: zhes pas te de las slar yang yon chab la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas te de las slar yang yon chab la sogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should again offer the water for the feet and so forth.

original: 'di ni sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //🔽gal te gang zhigs lhag par gnas pa'i sngon du sa yongs su gzung ba dang bgegs la phur bus gdab par 'dod pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o // gal te gang zhigs lhag par gnas pa'i sngon du sa yongs su gzung ba dang bgegs la phur bus gdab par 'dod pa yod do //
translated: This is the ritual of the consecration of the earth.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: If one wishes to perform the taking of the ground and the nailing down of the obstructors prior to the consecration, that is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir na lhag gnas la yongs su bzung ba don yod pa'i phyir dang / bgegs la phur bu gdab pa'i chog yangs sbyang ba'i dus su rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na lhag gnas la yongs su bzung ba don yod pa'i phyir dang / bgegs la phur bu gdab pa'i chog yangs sbyang ba'i dus su rigs te /
translated: Why is that? Because the taking of the ground is meaningless for the consecration, and the ritual of nailing down the obstructors is appropriate at the time of the purification.

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas bgegs bsreg cing rnam par bcom nas phur bus btang ste sa sbyang bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgoms pas bgegs bsreg cing rnam par bcom nas phur bus btang ste sa sbyang bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is proper to purify the ground by burning and destroying the obstructors by meditating on the protection wheel and then driving them out with the kīla.

original: de yang rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud las /
translated: Moreover, the tantra says:

original: de rnams kun la gsol ba btab ste seng ldeng las byung mkhrang ba'i phur pa rnams kyis sa la gdab //🔽ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kun la gsol ba btab ste seng ldeng las byung mkhrang ba'i phur pa rnams kyis sa la gdab // ces gsungs pas so //
translated: Having supplicated all of them, drive them into the ground with the kīlas made from khadira wood.

original: gal te dus gsum du mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su yang bgegs la phur bus gdab par @122b 'dod pa la nyin mtshan gyis bar du chod pa la ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dus gsum du mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus su yang bgegs la phur bus gdab par @122b 'dod pa la nyin mtshan gyis bar du chod pa la ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If you assert that you drive the kīla into the obstructors at the time of the three samādhis, why do you not assert that day and night are interrupted?

original: sgom pa'i dus su 'dod de /
analyzed: sgom pa'i dus su 'dod de /
translated: We assert that at the time of meditation.

original: 'on kyang seng ldeng la sogs pa'i phur bu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang seng ldeng la sogs pa'i phur bu mi 'dod do //
translated: However, we do not assert that the kīla is made of khadira wood and so on.

original: khyod kyi 'dod pa ltar na tshon bri ba'i skabs su yang bgegs la phur bu 'debs pa'i cho ga dgos par thal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pa ltar na tshon bri ba'i skabs su yang bgegs la phur bu 'debs pa'i cho ga dgos par thal lo //
translated: According to your assertion, it would follow that at the time of drawing the lines, you would need the rite of driving the kīla into the obstructors.

original: sa lhag par gnas pa sngon du byas pa'i phyir 'dir thal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sa lhag par gnas pa sngon du byas pa'i phyir 'dir thal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Here, that is not the case because you have already performed the consecration of the ground.

original: 'on te sa sbyang ba'i skabs su de ltar byas pa'i phyir sa lhag par gnas pa'i sngon du bgegs la phur bu gdab pa'i cho ga dgos par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te sa sbyang ba'i skabs su de ltar byas pa'i phyir sa lhag par gnas pa'i sngon du bgegs la phur bu gdab pa'i cho ga dgos par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, because it is done at the time of purifying the ground, the rite of striking the obstruction with the kīla is not necessary prior to the consecration of the ground.

original: de nas slob ma rnams khrus byas pa dang dri zhim pas lus la byugs te /
analyzed: de nas slob ma rnams khrus byas pa dang dri zhim pas lus la byugs te /
translated: Then, the disciples should be bathed and anointed with fragrant substances.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas so shing gis brtag par byas pa dang / de'i 'khor lo drug rnams su zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan drug la ring po drug gis thabs kyi rigs rnams la sku gsung thugs kyi bye brag gis bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas so shing gis brtag par byas pa dang / de'i 'khor lo drug rnams su zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan drug la ring po drug gis thabs kyi rigs rnams la sku gsung thugs kyi bye brag gis bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Having performed the examination with the tooth stick as will be explained, one should protect the six wheels of the disciples with the six long vowels on the six seats of the moon, etc., in the families of the method, by way of the distinctions of body, speech, and mind.

original: thung du drug gis shes rab kyi la'o //
analyzed: thung du drug gis shes rab kyi la'o //
translated: With the six short vowels, one should protect the wisdom consort.

original: de ltar rab tu gnas par bya ba yang ste lugs ma la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu gnas par bya ba yang ste lugs ma la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In that way, one should also consecrate the statues, etc.

original: po ti rnams la thung du rnams kyis so //
analyzed: po ti rnams la thung du rnams kyis so //
translated: With the short vowels, one should consecrate the books.

original: de nas gsol ba gdab par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas gsol ba gdab par bya ba ni /
translated: Then, one should request the empowerment.

original: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i rgyu ru dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor bdag gis bri bar bya //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni thar pa'i rgyu ru dpal ldan dus kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor bdag gis bri bar bya //
translated: I will draw the mandala of the glorious Kālacakra for the sake of the liberation of sentient beings.

original: zhes pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis slob ma la sogs pa rnams la byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis slob ma la sogs pa rnams la byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas and bodhisattvas bless the disciples and so forth.

original: 'di ni slob ma gzung ba'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni slob ma gzung ba'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for accepting the disciples.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la yi ge drug pa bzlas shid dri zhim po dang bdud rtsi lngas nye bar byugs te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la yi ge drug pa bzlas shid dri zhim po dang bdud rtsi lngas nye bar byugs te /
translated: Then, on the ground of the mandala, one should recite the six-syllable mantra and anoint it with fragrant substances and the five nectars.

original: me tog gi tshogs chal bar bkram la lus la khrus byas dri zhim pos byugs /
analyzed: me tog gi tshogs chal bar bkram la lus la khrus byas dri zhim pos byugs /
translated: Scatter a profusion of flowers and anoint the body with fragrant substances.

original: na bza' dmar po dang me tog gi phreng bas brgyan /
analyzed: na bza' dmar po dang me tog gi phreng bas brgyan /
translated: Adorn it with red garments and flower garlands.

original: rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / lag gdub dang / rkang gdub dang / ska rags dang / gtsug gi nor bu dang / thal ba dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / stag gi pags pa rnams kyi rgyan sgrub thabs su gsungs pa ltar sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la brgyan par bya'a  //
analyzed: rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / lag gdub dang / rkang gdub dang / ska rags dang / gtsug gi nor bu dang / thal ba dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / mchod phyir thogs dang / stag gi pags pa rnams kyi rgyan sgrub thabs su gsungs pa ltar sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la brgyan par bya'a  //
translated: The ornaments are the earrings, necklace, armlets, bracelets, anklets, belt, crest jewel, ashes, half-moon, sacred thread, and tiger-skin skirt, which are blessed with the mantra as taught in the sādhana.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar du gnas nas nub tu kha phyogs te dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lha rnams kyi bzhugs gnas go bar byas la tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pas mandala byas te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar du gnas nas nub tu kha phyogs te dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas lha rnams kyi bzhugs gnas go bar byas la tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pas mandala byas te /
translated: Then, standing in the east of the maṇḍala, facing west, possessing the yoga of the principal deity of the maṇḍala, understanding the seats of the deities, one should make a maṇḍala with sandalwood, saffron, and so forth.

original: de dang de rnams su dam tshig gi 'khor lo rnam par bsgoms la de rnams la nam mkhar gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' spyan drangs te @123a * //
analyzed: de dang de rnams su dam tshig gi 'khor lo rnam par bsgoms la de rnams la nam mkhar gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' spyan drangs te @123a * //
translated: In those places, having visualized the commitment wheel, the wisdom beings abiding in the space are invited.

original: gzhug pa dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga rnams byas la bsgom bya'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la bum pa drug gam bcu lhag par gnas par bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhug pa dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga rnams byas la bsgom bya'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la bum pa drug gam bcu lhag par gnas par bya ba ni /
translated: Having performed the rites of entry, offering, praise, and tasting the elixir, one should consecrate the six or ten vases outside of the mandala to be meditated on in the east and so on.

original: de yang zhib dang rgyas pa la bum pa'i nang gi rgyal sor bcu drug pa srid du 'og nas mchu'i bar du sor nyi shu pa mchu 'og tu 'phyang ba la sor gnyis pa /
analyzed: de yang zhib dang rgyas pa la bum pa'i nang gi rgyal sor bcu drug pa srid du 'og nas mchu'i bar du sor nyi shu pa mchu 'og tu 'phyang ba la sor gnyis pa /
translated: Moreover, for pacifying and increasing, the neck of the vase is sixteen finger lengths high and twenty finger lengths in circumference, with a lip that hangs down two finger lengths.

original: mgrin pa la sor drug pa kha'i mchu nas mchu la sor brgyad pa brgyad kyi cha gnyis dbus kyi bug pa la yod pa mchu gnyis la cha gcig pa /
analyzed: mgrin pa la sor drug pa kha'i mchu nas mchu la sor brgyad pa brgyad kyi cha gnyis dbus kyi bug pa la yod pa mchu gnyis la cha gcig pa /
translated: The neck is six finger lengths, and the lip of the mouth is eight finger lengths. Two of the eight parts are in the central hole, and one part is in each of the two lips.

original: gsad pa la dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / mi'i zhag gis byugs pa'i mi'i thod ba'o //
analyzed: gsad pa la dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / mi'i zhag gis byugs pa'i mi'i thod ba'o //
translated: For killing, the vase is smeared with charnel ground ash and human fat, and it is a human skull.

original: dbye ba dang bskrad pa la bum pa'i nang gi rgyal sor bcu gnyis pa srid du sor bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: dbye ba dang bskrad pa la bum pa'i nang gi rgyal sor bcu gnyis pa srid du sor bcu bzhi pa /
translated: For dividing and expelling, the neck of the vase is twelve finger lengths high and fourteen finger lengths in circumference.

original: mgrin pa la sor brgyad de cung zad 'khyogs pa kha la sor drug pa mchu la sor gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa la sor brgyad de cung zad 'khyogs pa kha la sor drug pa mchu la sor gcig pa'o //
translated: The neck is eight finger-breadths, slightly bent, and the mouth is six finger-breadths, with the lips one finger-breadth.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'i bum pa'o //
translated: For enthrallment and summoning, the vase is made by an artisan.

original: rengs pa la thung zhing rgya dang srid du sor bcu drug pa /
analyzed: rengs pa la thung zhing rgya dang srid du sor bcu drug pa /
translated: For immobilization, it is short, and sixteen finger-breadths in circumference and height.

original: mgrin pa la sor ba zhi pa kha la sor drug pa mchu la sor gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa la sor ba zhi pa kha la sor drug pa mchu la sor gnyis pa'o //
translated: The neck is four finger-breadths, the mouth six finger-breadths, and the lips two finger-breadths.

original: las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la bshad pa'i bum pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad pa la zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la bshad pa'i bum pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: For all activities, one should take the vase explained for the activities of pacification, and so on.

original: gser ram dngul lam shel lam zangs rnams las byas pa'i bum pa ji ltar rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: gser ram dngul lam shel lam zangs rnams las byas pa'i bum pa ji ltar rnyed pa'am /
translated: The vase is made of gold, silver, crystal, or copper, as much as one can obtain.

original: gser la sogs pa med na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams stong par byas te /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa med na bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams stong par byas te /
translated: If one does not have gold, and so on, one should make it from clay, having the explained characteristics, and make it empty.🔽One should imagine the form of a jewel from the syllable vaṃ, and for the sake of pacification and enrichment, one should smear it with rice or with a paste of white sandalwood.

original: bam las rin po che'i gzugs su bsams la zhib dang rgyas pa'i don du 'bras sam rdo rje rgyus sam tsandan dkar pos byug / lha rnams kyi mtshan ma bri /
analyzed: bam las rin po che'i gzugs su bsams la zhib dang rgyas pa'i don du 'bras sam rdo rje rgyus sam tsandan dkar pos byug / lha rnams kyi mtshan ma bri /
translated: One should draw the symbols of the deities.

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu dang / rin po che lnga dang / sman lnga dang / 'brul lnga rnams nang du'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu dang / rin po che lnga dang / sman lnga dang / 'brul lnga rnams nang du'o //
translated: The inner [part] is perfumed water with the five nectars, the five precious substances, the five medicines, and the five grains.

original: mdzes pa'i shing dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa'i shing dang ldan pa /
translated: [It] is endowed with beautiful trees.🔽[It] is wrapped with a pair of cloths around the neck.

original: mgrin par ras zung gis dkris pa bla re'i 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pa ltar dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dri zhim po'i mandala ji ltar rigs pa'i gdan so sor byas pa'i steng du mdun du gzhag
analyzed: mgrin par ras zung gis dkris pa bla re'i 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor la mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pa ltar dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dri zhim po'i mandala ji ltar rigs pa'i gdan so sor byas pa'i steng du mdun du gzhag
translated: Under the canopy, on a fragrant mandala in the form of a maṇḍala, as will be explained in the section on arranging the signs in the maṇḍala of colored powder, one should make individual seats for each [deity] in an appropriate way.

original: go // de yang ras kyi skud pa dkar //
analyzed: go // de yang ras kyi skud pa dkar //
translated: [It] is also a white thread of cloth.

original: mkhas pas cho ga bzhin du dkri //
analyzed: mkhas pas cho ga bzhin du dkri //
translated: The wise one should wrap [it] according to the rite.

original: zhes pa 'di'i 'dod pa ltar na h'um lan bdun brjod pa'i skud pas aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta d'i sh'am bandh'a bandh'a h'um /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i 'dod pa ltar na h'um lan bdun brjod pa'i skud pas aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta d'i sh'am bandh'a bandh'a h'um /
translated: According to this desire, [one] should wrap [it] with a thread on which the seven syllable [mantra] is recited, with the mantra Oṃ vajra śikharesu rutamātrair dīrghaṃ bhandā bhandā hūṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: [It] should be wrapped.

original: da ni nang gi 'bru bcud rnams bstan pa /
analyzed: da ni nang gi 'bru bcud rnams bstan pa /
translated: Now, the inner grains and essences are explained.

original: aindra n'i la dang / padma r'a ga dang / zla ba chu shel dang / ka rke ta dang / ke ke ru rnams @123b dang / gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / rnon po dang / khab len te lcags rnams dang / de bzhin du mu tig dang /
analyzed: aindra n'i la dang / padma r'a ga dang / zla ba chu shel dang / ka rke ta dang / ke ke ru rnams @123b dang / gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / rnon po dang / khab len te lcags rnams dang / de bzhin du mu tig dang /
translated: sapphire, ruby, moonstone, cat's eye, and beryl; gold, silver, copper, iron, and lodestone; and likewise pearl,

original: byu ru dang / mu men dang / sh'u la ma ni dang / thig le drug pa rnams ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: byu ru dang / mu men dang / sh'u la ma ni dang / thig le drug pa rnams ni 'bring po'o //
translated: coral, emerald, śaṅkhaśīla, and the sixth, tilaka, are middling.

original: shel dang / mchong dang / gzi dang / mching bu dang / nor bu sngo bsangs rnams ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: shel dang / mchong dang / gzi dang / mching bu dang / nor bu sngo bsangs rnams ni tha ma'o //
translated: Crystal, quartz, pyrite, glass, and blue gem are inferior.

original: de rnams med na dri zhim po'i me tog kha dog lnga yis so //
analyzed: de rnams med na dri zhim po'i me tog kha dog lnga yis so //
translated: If those are not available, use fragrant flowers of five colors.

original: yang brahma dandi cha gnyis dang / bishnu kr'anta cha gcig dang / ru tra dz'a t'a cha gsum dang / a'i sh'a ri cha bzhi dang / de w'a t'a li cha lnga la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang brahma dandi cha gnyis dang / bishnu kr'anta cha gcig dang / ru tra dz'a t'a cha gsum dang / a'i sh'a ri cha bzhi dang / de w'a t'a li cha lnga la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Moreover, there are two parts of brahmadandī, one part of viṣṇukṛnt, three parts of rudrājatā, four parts of ājyaśrī, five parts of devātalī, and so on.

original: yang til dang / nas dang / sran ma sha dang / so ba dang / gro la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang til dang / nas dang / sran ma sha dang / so ba dang / gro la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Also sesame, barley, beans, wheat, and so forth.

original: yang sgyur shing dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / mya ngan med dang / byang chub shing dang au dum w'ar la sogs pa'i shing rnams so //
analyzed: yang sgyur shing dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / mya ngan med dang / byang chub shing dang au dum w'ar la sogs pa'i shing rnams so //
translated: Also trees such as the wish-fulfilling tree, the ironwood tree, the aśoka tree, the bodhi tree, and the udumbara tree.

original: yang ras ni sngon po dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po rnams so //
analyzed: yang ras ni sngon po dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po rnams so //
translated: Also cloth such as blue, black, red, white, and yellow.

original: rnam rgyal gyi bum pa la sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la dkar po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / ser po ste /
analyzed: rnam rgyal gyi bum pa la sna tshogs padma'i lte ba la dkar po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / ser po ste /
translated: In the victorious vase, on the center of a multicolored lotus, are white, red, black, and yellow.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang dus kyi me'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyi steng du rdo rje rtse gsum pa sngon po bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang dus kyi me'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyi steng du rdo rje rtse gsum pa sngon po bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
translated: On the moon, sun, Rāhu, and the circle of the fire of time, there is a blue three-pointed vajra, which is the Bhagavān’s.

original: shar gyi bum pa la ral gri nag po /
analyzed: shar gyi bum pa la ral gri nag po /
translated: In the eastern vase, there is a black sword.

original: lho'i la rin po che dmar po /
analyzed: lho'i la rin po che dmar po /
translated: In the southern, there is a red jewel.

original: nub ni la 'khor lo ser po /🔽byang gi la padma dkar po /
analyzed: nub ni la 'khor lo ser po / byang gi la padma dkar po /
translated: In the western, there is a yellow wheel.🔽In the northern, there is a white lotus.

original: me mtshams kyi la ral gri nag po /
analyzed: me mtshams kyi la ral gri nag po /
translated: In the southeast, there is a black sword.

original: bden bral gyi la padma dmar po /🔽bde byed kyi la autpala dkar po /
analyzed: bden bral gyi la padma dmar po / bde byed kyi la autpala dkar po /
translated: On the southwest corner, a red lotus.🔽On the northeast corner, a white utpala.

original: rlung gi la 'khor lo ser po rnams bri zhing /🔽nub kyi rgyal ba'i bum pa la gri gug bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi la 'khor lo ser po rnams bri zhing / nub kyi rgyal ba'i bum pa la gri gug bri bar bya'o //
translated: On the northwest corner, a yellow wheel.🔽On the west, on the Victorious Vase, a curved knife.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung gzhag go //
translated: On top of the Victorious Vase, place the Great Victorious Conch.

original: de rnams las rnam par rgyal ba chen por rin po che ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de rnams las rnam par rgyal ba chen por rin po che ljang gu'o //
translated: Among them, the Great Victorious is green.

original: rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal bar sngon po'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba dang rnam par rgyal bar sngon po'o //
translated: The Victorious and the Victorious-Victorious are blue.

original: shar dang mer nag po'o //
analyzed: shar dang mer nag po'o //
translated: The east and the south are black.

original: lho dang bden bral du dmar po'o //
analyzed: lho dang bden bral du dmar po'o //
translated: The south and the southwest are red.

original: byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang dang dbang ldan du dkar po'o //
translated: The north and the northeast are white.

original: nub dang rlung du ser po'o //
analyzed: nub dang rlung du ser po'o //
translated: The west and the northwest are yellow.

original: de ltar khab len dang / rnon po dang / zangs ma dang / dngul dang / gser rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar khab len dang / rnon po dang / zangs ma dang / dngul dang / gser rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, the iron, the sharp, the copper, the silver, and the gold.

original: de ltar sman rnams cha gcig rnam par rgyal ba la'o //
analyzed: de ltar sman rnams cha gcig rnam par rgyal ba la'o //
translated: Thus, the herbs are one part of the Victorious.

original: de ltar cha gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa rnam rim pa bzhin shar dag /
analyzed: de ltar cha gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa rnam rim pa bzhin shar dag /
translated: In this way, the second, third, fourth, and fifth parts are placed in the east, etc., in order.

original: me dang / lho dang bden bral dang / byang dang / dbang ldan dang / nub dang / rlung rnams kyi bum pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: me dang / lho dang bden bral dang / byang dang / dbang ldan dang / nub dang / rlung rnams kyi bum pa rnams su'o //
translated: The vases of fire, south, southwest, north, northeast, west, and wind are placed in the east, etc.

original: thams cad gtums pa rnams par rgyal ba chen por bcug ste /🔽de gtso bo bya ba kun byed pa'i @124a * //
analyzed: thams cad gtums pa rnams par rgyal ba chen por bcug ste / de gtso bo bya ba kun byed pa'i @124a * //
translated: The completely covered one is placed in the great victory vase.

original: rnam rgyal steng du bzhag la der sngar bstan pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu blugs /
analyzed: rnam rgyal steng du bzhag la der sngar bstan pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu blugs /
translated: That one is placed on top of the victory vase, and fragrant water with the five elixirs as previously described is poured into it.

original: me tog phreng bas brgyan /
analyzed: me tog phreng bas brgyan /
translated: It is adorned with a flower garland.

original: aom badzra aa mri ta au da ka tha h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra aa mri ta au da ka tha h'um /
translated: Om vajra amrita udaka tha hum.

original: zhes pa dang yi ge drug pa lan bdun bzlas te /
analyzed: zhes pa dang yi ge drug pa lan bdun bzlas te /
translated: Recite the six-syllable mantra seven times.

original: de ltar bdud rtsir byas la de'i nang du aom t'a pte t'a pte ma h'a t'a pte sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de ltar bdud rtsir byas la de'i nang du aom t'a pte t'a pte ma h'a t'a pte sv'a h'a /
translated: In this way, having made it an elixir, recite Om tapate maha tapate svha.

original: zhes pas lha'i chu'i rang bzhin spyan drangs pa dang / lha'i 'khor lo gdan dang bcas pa rnam par bsams la rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes pa spyan drangs te /
analyzed: zhes pas lha'i chu'i rang bzhin spyan drangs pa dang / lha'i 'khor lo gdan dang bcas pa rnam par bsams la rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes pa spyan drangs te /
translated: Having invited the nature of the water of the deities, and having imagined the wheel of the deities with the seats, one should invite the awareness beings with light rays from the seed in one's heart.

original: zhabs bsil dang 'thor 'thung dang yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song ba dang / de nyid dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gzhug go //
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang 'thor 'thung dang yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song ba dang / de nyid dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gzhug go //
translated: Having performed the preliminary of washing the feet, sprinkling water, and offering water for the mouth, and so on, one should cause the awareness beings to enter into the commitment wheel.

original: de'i nang du chags pa chen pos zhu ba dang / byang chub sems kyi gzugs su ro gcig tu gyur pa rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i nang du chags pa chen pos zhu ba dang / byang chub sems kyi gzugs su ro gcig tu gyur pa rnam par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that they melt through great passion and become of one taste in the form of bodhicitta.

original: yang mtshan ma las dam tshig gi lha dang / ye shes kyi lha yang ro gcig tu gyur par blta'o //
analyzed: yang mtshan ma las dam tshig gi lha dang / ye shes kyi lha yang ro gcig tu gyur par blta'o //
translated: Again, one should view the commitment deity and the awareness deity as becoming of one taste through the sign.

original: de yang ma tog gi phreng ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje bzung bas rnam rgyal kyi  bum pa la sogs pa la reg la 'khor lo'i gtso po'i snying po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang / aom ham h'am him h'im h'i h'im hum h'um hlim hl'im badzra padma aa mri ta gha ta su bi shudda dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su bi shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su be shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a w'am
analyzed: de yang ma tog gi phreng ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje bzung bas rnam rgyal kyi  bum pa la sogs pa la reg la 'khor lo'i gtso po'i snying po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dang / aom ham h'am him h'im h'i h'im hum h'um hlim hl'im badzra padma aa mri ta gha ta su bi shudda dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su bi shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a ba sarba dharm'a na su be shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu sva bh'a w'am
translated: Also, by holding the vajra with a garland of flowers, touch the victorious vase, and so on, and recite the essence mantra of the principal of the wheel one hundred and eight times, and recite the mantra:

original: ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ haṃ hāṃ him hīṃ hīṃ hūṃ hūṃ hliṃ laṃ vajra padma amṛta ghata suviśuddha dharmadhātu svabhāva sarva dharmāṇi suviśuddha dharmadhātu svabhāva sarva dharmāṇi suviśuddha dharmadhātu svabhāvaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: zhes pa'i sngags bzlas shing dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa bzhag go //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags bzlas shing dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa bzhag go //
translated: Recite this mantra and place the victorious vase in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: bum pa gzhan rnams ni lha rang rang gi sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig dang sngags 'di lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te rang rang gi gnas su gzhag go //
analyzed: bum pa gzhan rnams ni lha rang rang gi sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig dang sngags 'di lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te rang rang gi gnas su gzhag go //
translated: Recite the individual mantras of the other deities twenty-one times, and recite this mantra twenty-one times, and place them in their individual places.

original: de nas rnam rgyal la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: de nas rnam rgyal la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the vases such as the victory vase with flowers and so forth,

original: ji srid dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rdzogs kyi bar de srid du bgegs rnams srung bar gyis shig ces brjod la gtor ma byin pa dang de rnams la reg ste /🔽mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud //
analyzed: ji srid dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rdzogs kyi bar de srid du bgegs rnams srung bar gyis shig ces brjod la gtor ma byin pa dang de rnams la reg ste / mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud //
translated: say, “Please guard against obstacles for as long as the maṇḍala activities are completed.”🔽Having given the bali, touch them and recite the praise beginning with “I bow to you, Vajra of generosity” and so on.

original: ces pa la sogs pas bstod pa sngon du song ba dang drul bu dkrol bar bya ba'i sngags ni /🔽aom hram h'im hram hr'im hr'lm hr'a:/🔽aom badzra tv'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom aa mo gha siddha ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom ratna sam bha w'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom aa mi t'a bh'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom bee ro tsa n'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom t'a re tu tt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /🔽aom p'a nad ra w'a si ni w'ar de sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas bstod pa sngon du song ba dang drul bu dkrol bar bya ba'i sngags ni / aom hram h'im hram hr'im hr'lm hr'a:/ aom badzra tv'a ya sv'a h'a / aom aa mo gha siddha ya sv'a h'a / aom ratna sam bha w'a ya sv'a h'a / aom aa mi t'a bh'a ya sv'a h'a / aom bee ro tsa n'a ya sv'a h'a / aom t'a re tu tt'a re tu re sv'a h'a / aom p'a nad ra w'a si ni w'ar de sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra for playing the ḍamaru is:

analyzed: aom ma ma k'i ki ri ki ri sv'a h'a /
