original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha snam kyi  snam bu dkar po'o //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi lha snam kyi  snam bu dkar po'o //
translated: The platform of the deities of the maṇḍala of speech is white.

original: de nyid la padma brgyad po ni nyi ma dang zla ba dang bral ba'i phyogs rnams dmar po'o /
analyzed: de nyid la padma brgyad po ni nyi ma dang zla ba dang bral ba'i phyogs rnams dmar po'o /
translated: The eight lotuses are red in the directions that are free from the sun and moon.

original: mtshams rnams dkar po'o //
analyzed: mtshams rnams dkar po'o //
translated: The intermediate directions are white.

original: rab lnga ni nang nas rim gyis ljang gu dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po rnams so //
analyzed: rab lnga ni nang nas rim gyis ljang gu dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po rnams so //
translated: The five lines are green, black, red, white, and yellow, respectively, from the inside.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung dang mtshungs pa las rta babs kyi ka ba'i 'og rtsig pa'i rtsar gdengs ka rnams kyi gdan te so so la cha bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor ni gsung dang mtshungs pa las rta babs kyi ka ba'i 'og rtsig pa'i rtsar gdengs ka rnams kyi gdan te so so la cha bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of body is similar to the maṇḍala of speech. The bases of the pillars of the gateways are the bases of the walls at the edge of the maṇḍala. Each is twelve cubits.

original: de yang shar phyogs su rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po zlum po steng du rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa dag go //
analyzed: de yang shar phyogs su rlung gi dkyil 'khor nag po zlum po steng du rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa dag go //
translated: In the east, there are black, round air maṇḍalas, which are marked with victory banners.

original: lho phyogs su gru gsum g-yung drung ris kyi sa mtshan pa dag go //
analyzed: lho phyogs su gru gsum g-yung drung ris kyi sa mtshan pa dag go //
translated: In the south, there are triangular swastikas.

original: nub phyogs su gru bzhi rdo rjes mtshan ma dag go //
analyzed: nub phyogs su gru bzhi rdo rjes mtshan ma dag go //
translated: In the west, there are squares marked with vajras.

original: byang phyogs su zla phyed rnam pa padmas mtshan pa dag go //🔽shar phyogs kyi g-yas kyi zlum po'i g-yas su bdud rtsi'i bum pa klu'i rgyal po rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su zla phyed rnam pa padmas mtshan pa dag go // shar phyogs kyi g-yas kyi zlum po'i g-yas su bdud rtsi'i bum pa klu'i rgyal po rgyal ba'o //
translated: In the north, the half-moons are marked with lotuses.🔽To the right of the circle to the right of the east is the vase of nectar, the naga king Jayanta.

original: nub phyogs kyi g-yon gyi gru bzhi'i g-yon du bdud rtsi'i bum pa rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi g-yon gyi gru bzhi'i g-yon du bdud rtsi'i bum pa rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: To the left of the square to the left of the west is the vase of nectar, the naga king Takshaka.

original: shar phyogs kyi rta babs kyi rtsegs dang po'i gnas dbus ma chos kyi 'khor lo dag dang / g-yas dang g-yon du ri dags pho dang mo rnams nag po'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi rta babs kyi rtsegs dang po'i gnas dbus ma chos kyi 'khor lo dag dang / g-yas dang g-yon du ri dags pho dang mo rnams nag po'o //
translated: On the first tier of the arch in the east, in the center is the dharmacakra, and to the right and left are the male and female deer, black.

original: lho phyogs su @129a * //
analyzed: lho phyogs su @129a * //
translated: In the south

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba lugs dang mi mthun pa'i chos de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba lugs dang mi mthun pa'i chos de rnams kyis so //
translated: are the characteristics, the reverse of the above.

original: sangs rgyas zhes ba gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes ba gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The buddha is the aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes pa mig dang rnam ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi dbang po'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes pa mig dang rnam ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi dbang po'i khams rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattvas are the elements of the eye, form, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: kyang yig gis sa la sogs pa'i khams dang gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams rnams mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: kyang yig gis sa la sogs pa'i khams dang gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams rnams mchod par bya ste /
translated: The word “also” indicates that the elements of earth and so on, and the elements of form and so on, should be worshipped.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa'i thig les bde ba chen po 'gyur ba med pa rnams kyis yongs su dag par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi 'dzag pa'i thig les bde ba chen po 'gyur ba med pa rnams kyis yongs su dag par bya'o zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: They should be purified by the drops of the bodhicitta that do not fall, which are the unchanging great bliss. This is the definitive meaning.

original: phyi rol du slar yang thig le 'dzag pas nyams su myong ba rnams kyis phyi rol rnam par dag pa'i don du mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du slar yang thig le 'dzag pas nyams su myong ba rnams kyis phyi rol rnam par dag pa'i don du mchod par bya'o //
translated: Externally, the experiences of the falling of the drops should be worshipped for the sake of the external purification.

original: nang du ni phyag rgya chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir rang rdzas thig le nor bu'i nang du son pa rnams kyis mchod pa'o zhes pa thig le'i mchod pa'i nges pa'o ;
analyzed: nang du ni phyag rgya chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir rang rdzas thig le nor bu'i nang du son pa rnams kyis mchod pa'o zhes pa thig le'i mchod pa'i nges pa'o ;
translated: Internally, the drops that are one’s own substance, which are located in the jewel, should be worshipped for the sake of the purification of the great seal. This is the determination of the worship of the drops.

original: / de ni mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa sdig pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ni mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa sdig pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: He is liberated from all sins, and so on.

original: 'dir mthong ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, seeing is twofold:

original: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: external and internal.

original: de bzhin du reg pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, touching.

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi mthong ba ni las kyi phyag rgya dang mthong ba dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya rab tu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi mthong ba ni las kyi phyag rgya dang mthong ba dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya rab tu brtag par bya'o //
translated: Here, external seeing is the investigation of the karmamudra and the jnanamudra.

original: reg pa ni de dag gi kha dang stan dang skye gnas la reg pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni de dag gi kha dang stan dang skye gnas la reg pa ste /
translated: Touching is touching their mouth, seat, and vagina.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa gnyis po de dag las zhes so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa gnyis po de dag las zhes so //
translated: From those two, seeing and touching.

original: nang du ni khams gsum pa ma lus pa sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan du mthong ba dang / phyag rgya chen po mthong ba dang / de dag gi bde ba chen po la reg pa dang / mthong ba dang reg pa gnyis po de dag las zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni khams gsum pa ma lus pa sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan du mthong ba dang / phyag rgya chen po mthong ba dang / de dag gi bde ba chen po la reg pa dang / mthong ba dang reg pa gnyis po de dag las zhes pa'o //
translated: Internally, seeing the entire three realms as the reflection of the Buddha, seeing the mahamudra, and touching their great bliss is from those two, seeing and touching.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: thos pa dang ni dran pas kyang //
analyzed: thos pa dang ni dran pas kyang //
translated: hearing and remembering

original: zhes pa 'dir dam pa'i chos thos pa dang bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bo dang dpa' bo dang dba' mo'i dbang phyug ma dran pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir dam pa'i chos thos pa dang bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bo dang dpa' bo dang dba' mo'i dbang phyug ma dran pas zhes pa ste /
translated: Here, by hearing the holy Dharma, by remembering the guru, the Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, the heroes and heroines, one is freed from all evil.

original: thos pa dang dran pa de dag gis kyang /
analyzed: thos pa dang dran pa de dag gis kyang /
translated: By hearing and by remembering,

original: sdig pa kun las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa kun las grol bar 'gyur //
translated: one is freed from all evil.

original: zhes pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyis byas pa'i mi dge ba bcu dang mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa de rnams thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽sdig pa rnams mi bye dpa'i sdom pa la gnas te /
analyzed: zhes pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyis byas pa'i mi dge ba bcu dang mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa de rnams thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro // sdig pa rnams mi bye dpa'i sdom pa la gnas te /
translated: One is freed from all the ten nonvirtues committed by body, speech, and mind, from the five crimes with immediate retribution, and so forth.🔽One abides in the vow not to commit evil.

original: rjes @129b su gnang ba'i dus las sdig pa rnams mi byed pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rjes @129b su gnang ba'i dus las sdig pa rnams mi byed pa'i sdom pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: One abides in the vow not to commit evil, except in the case of the permitted times.

original: slar rjes su gnang ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig chags pa la sogs pa byas pa rnams las kyang rnams par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar rjes su gnang ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig chags pa la sogs pa byas pa rnams las kyang rnams par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is freed from any evil that one might have committed, such as attachment, which is not permitted.

original: de ltar the tshom med pa nyid //
analyzed: de ltar the tshom med pa nyid //
translated: Thus, one is without doubt.

original: ces pa de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rnal 'byor pa rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi spangs pa bha ga lingga mnyam par sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba chen po bsgoms pas bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir sdig pa las grol ba'i cho
analyzed: ces pa de ltar gsungs pa'i rim pas rnal 'byor pa rtsa ba'i ltung ba bcu bzhi spangs pa bha ga lingga mnyam par sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba chen po bsgoms pas bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir sdig pa las grol ba'i cho
translated: In this way, the yogin who has abandoned the fourteen root downfalls, by the union of bhaga and linga, cultivates the bliss of the non-emission of bodhicitta, and is thereby liberated from sin by the method of generating merit.

original: ga'o // da ni rnal 'byor pa nyid ces pa la sogs pas gang gis sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa'i thabs de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ga'o // da ni rnal 'byor pa nyid ces pa la sogs pas gang gis sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa'i thabs de brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “yoga itself,” the means by which buddhahood is accomplished should be stated.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Here, yoga itself is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnal 'byor ba ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: Among them, the supramundane yogin is buddhahood itself.

original: de'i khyad par ni bsod nams mchog ste bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni bsod nams mchog ste bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Its distinction is supreme merit, because the accumulation of merit is perfected.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
analyzed: dag byed sdig pa 'jig byed pa //
translated: the purifier, the destroyer of sin,

original: zhes pa de nyid ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is the perfection of the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de ni sangs rgyas nyid du /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas nyid du /
translated: That is buddhahood.

original: sngags bzlas pa dang bsam gtan dang / bde ba yis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa dang bsam gtan dang / bde ba yis kyang 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: One also achieves through mantra recitation, meditation, and bliss.

original: zhes pa 'dir thabs 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid du 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir thabs 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid du 'grub ste /
translated: Here, by this method, the yogis achieve the state of the yogis as taught.

original: 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa lung gis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa lung gis brjod pa'o //
translated: The word achieve is stated in the scriptures.

original: 'di'i thabs ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor te 'dir bar du yan lag re re dor ba'i bar ni rim pas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di'i thabs ni yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor te 'dir bar du yan lag re re dor ba'i bar ni rim pas gsungs so //
translated: The method here is the yoga of the six limbs. Here, the limbs are taught in order, with each limb being omitted in turn.

original: yan lag snga ma la ma brjod pa de nyid ni yan lag phyi ma la brjod pa'i shugs nyid las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma la ma brjod pa de nyid ni yan lag phyi ma la brjod pa'i shugs nyid las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: What is not stated in the earlier limbs is to be understood by implication in the later limbs.

original: ji ltar 'dir ni nyin mor byed pa zhes brjod pa na gzhan mtshan mor byed pa zhes brjod kyang shugs nyid las nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir ni nyin mor byed pa zhes brjod pa na gzhan mtshan mor byed pa zhes brjod kyang shugs nyid las nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as here, when the word sun is stated, the other, moon, is also implied by implication.

original: de bzhin du phan tshun ltos pa'i chos ni ma brjod kyang brjod pa'i shugs nyid las nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phan tshun ltos pa'i chos ni ma brjod kyang brjod pa'i shugs nyid las nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the phenomena that are mutually dependent are not mentioned, but are to be understood by implication from what is mentioned.

original: de'i phyir rgyud 'dir yan lag re re khongs su gtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan gsum bstan pas bar gyi yan lag brjod pa ni sngon la rig par bya ste 'dir bla ma'i man ngag las shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud 'dir yan lag re re khongs su gtogs pa'i yan lag gzhan gsum bstan pas bar gyi yan lag brjod pa ni sngon la rig par bya ste 'dir bla ma'i man ngag las shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in this tantra, the other three branches that are included in each branch are taught. The intermediate branches are to be understood first, and here they are to be known from the guru's instructions.

original: gzhan du gal te rgyud las gsungs pa bklags pa'i rim pa gzung bar bya @130a * //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te rgyud las gsungs pa bklags pa'i rim pa gzung bar bya @130a * //
translated: Otherwise, if the order of recitation from the tantra is to be taken,

original: phyogs su 'bras bu dang bdud rtsis gang ba'i snod dkar po'o //
analyzed: phyogs su 'bras bu dang bdud rtsis gang ba'i snod dkar po'o //
translated: in the east, a white vessel filled with the result and nectar.

original: de ltar 'dod yon snam bu kun la glu ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod yon snam bu kun la glu ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: Thus, on all the desire-object platforms, there are offering goddesses such as the songresses and so on.

original: shar gyi rta babs kyi mchod pa'i gnas kyi dbus su gos so //
analyzed: shar gyi rta babs kyi mchod pa'i gnas kyi dbus su gos so //
translated: In the center of the offering place of the eastern gateway, there is cloth.

original: lho phyogs su padma'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs su padma'o //
translated: In the south, there is a lotus.

original: nub phyogs su phat ha'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs su phat ha'o //
translated: In the west, there is a fly-whisk.

original: byang phyogs su rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su rdo rje'o //
translated: In the north, there is a vajra.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi padma'i lte ba dang 'dab ma rnams la gri gug nag po rnams so //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi padma'i lte ba dang 'dab ma rnams la gri gug nag po rnams so //
translated: On the eastern lotus of the mandala of speech, in the center and on the petals, are black flaying knives.

original: me mtshams su 'khor lo nag po rnams so //🔽lho phyogs su dbyug pa dmar po rnams so //
analyzed: me mtshams su 'khor lo nag po rnams so // lho phyogs su dbyug pa dmar po rnams so //
translated: In the southeast are black wheels.🔽In the south are red clubs.

original: bden bral du mdung thung dmar po rnams so //🔽nub phyogs su rdo rje ser po'o //
analyzed: bden bral du mdung thung dmar po rnams so // nub phyogs su rdo rje ser po'o //
translated: In the southwest are red javelins.🔽In the west are yellow vajras.

original: rlung du tshangs pa'i dbyug pa ser po rnams so //🔽byang phyogs su rtse gsum ba dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: rlung du tshangs pa'i dbyug pa ser po rnams so // byang phyogs su rtse gsum ba dkar po rnams so //
translated: In the northwest are yellow Brahmā staffs.🔽In the north are white tridents.

original: dbang ldan du padma dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: dbang ldan du padma dkar po rnams so //
translated: In the northeast are white lotuses.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi padma'i lte ba dang / 'dab ma rnams gyi  mtshan ma rnams la /
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi padma'i lte ba dang / 'dab ma rnams gyi  mtshan ma rnams la /
translated: On the lotus of the mandala of body, in the center and on the petals, are the signs.

original: shar sgo'i g-yas su ral gri rnams so //
analyzed: shar sgo'i g-yas su ral gri rnams so //
translated: To the right of the eastern gate are swords.

original: me mtshams su dpag bsam gyi shing rnams so //
analyzed: me mtshams su dpag bsam gyi shing rnams so //
translated: In the southeast are wish-fulfilling trees.

original: lho'i sgo'i g-yon du rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbyug pa rnams so //🔽g-yas su mdung thung rnams so //
analyzed: lho'i sgo'i g-yon du rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbyug pa rnams so // g-yas su mdung thung rnams so //
translated: To the left of the southern gate are clubs marked with vajras.🔽To the right are javelins.

original: bden bral du mdung rnams so //
analyzed: bden bral du mdung rnams so //
translated: In the southwest are spears.

original: nub sgo'i g-yon du rin po che'am dbyug pa rnams so //
analyzed: nub sgo'i g-yon du rin po che'am dbyug pa rnams so //
translated: To the left of the western door are jewels or maces.

original: g-yas su rdo rje rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas su rdo rje rnams so //
translated: To the right are vajras.

original: rlung du khab rnams so //
analyzed: rlung du khab rnams so //
translated: In the wind direction are needles.

original: byang gi sgo'i g-yon du rtse gsum rnams so //
analyzed: byang gi sgo'i g-yon du rtse gsum rnams so //
translated: To the left of the northern door are tridents.

original: g-yas su zhags pa rnams so //🔽dbang ldan du dgra sta rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas su zhags pa rnams so // dbang ldan du dgra sta rnams so //
translated: To the right are lassos.🔽In the northeast are battle-axes.

original: shar sgo'i g-yon du 'khor lo rnams so //
analyzed: shar sgo'i g-yon du 'khor lo rnams so //
translated: To the left of the eastern door are wheels.

original: shar gyi sgo ru dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgo ru dbyug pa'o //
translated: At the eastern door is a mace.

original: de'i phyi rol du rdo rje ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du rdo rje ljang gu'o //
translated: Outside of that is a green vajra.

original: lho'i sgo ru mnga' dmar po'o //
analyzed: lho'i sgo ru mnga' dmar po'o //
translated: At the southern door is a red lotus.

original: nub kyi sgo ru dbyug to'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgo ru dbyug to'o //
translated: At the western door is a mace.

original: de'i phyi rol du rtse gsum sngon po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du rtse gsum sngon po'o //
translated: Outside of that is a blue trident.

original: byang gi sgo ru gtun shing dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgo ru gtun shing dkar po'o //
translated: At the northern door is a white pestle.

original: de ltar dbyug pa la sogs pa rnams padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbyug pa la sogs pa rnams padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus the maces and so on are located on lotuses and suns.

original: gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs kyi padma rnams dmar po'o //
analyzed: gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs kyi padma rnams dmar po'o //
translated: The lotuses in the directions of the maṇḍala of awakened speech are red.

original: mtshams kyi padma rnams dkar po'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi padma rnams dkar po'o //
translated: The lotuses in the intermediate directions are white.

original: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo'i 'dong yon gyi snam bu'i g-yas su autpala dang gos dang gri gu ga dang / 'khor lo dang kha tv'am ga rnams nag po'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsung gi dkyil 'khor gyi shar sgo'i 'dong yon gyi snam bu'i g-yas su autpala dang gos dang gri gu ga dang / 'khor lo dang kha tv'am ga rnams nag po'o //
translated: and the wheel and khaṭvāṅga are black.

original: g-yon du gri gug dang / ral gri dang / yang gri gug rnams nag po'o //
analyzed: g-yon du gri gug dang / ral gri dang / yang gri gug rnams nag po'o //
translated: To the left, the flaying knife, sword, and another flaying knife are black.

original: lho'i sgo'i g-yas su padma dang / bdud rtsi'i snod dang / dbyug pa dang / mdung thud dang / padma rnams dmar po'o //
analyzed: lho'i sgo'i g-yas su padma dang / bdud rtsi'i snod dang / dbyug pa dang / mdung thud dang / padma rnams dmar po'o //
translated: To the right of the southern door, the lotus, nectar vase, club, spear, and lotus are red.

original: g-yon du mda' dang / dgra @130b sta dang / gri gug dang / yang gi gug rnams dmar po'o //🔽nub sgo'i g-yas su 'khor lo dang / dri'i dung dang / rdo rje dang / khab dang / 'khor lo rnams ser po'o //
analyzed: g-yon du mda' dang / dgra @130b sta dang / gri gug dang / yang gi gug rnams dmar po'o // nub sgo'i g-yas su 'khor lo dang / dri'i dung dang / rdo rje dang / khab dang / 'khor lo rnams ser po'o //
translated: To the left, the arrow, battle-ax, flaying knife, and another flaying knife are red.🔽To the right of the western door, the wheel, perfume conch, vajra, needle, and discus are yellow.

original: g-yon du phub dang / chos 'byung dang / 'khor lo dang / gri gug rnams ser po'o //
analyzed: g-yon du phub dang / chos 'byung dang / 'khor lo dang / gri gug rnams ser po'o //
translated: To the left, the plow, source of phenomena, discus, and flaying knife are yellow.

original: byang sgo'i g-yas su autpala dang / me long dang / rtse gsum dang / padma dang / autpala rnams dkar pa'o //
analyzed: byang sgo'i g-yas su autpala dang / me long dang / rtse gsum dang / padma dang / autpala rnams dkar pa'o //
translated: To the right of the southern gate, the utpala, mirror, trident, lotus, and utpala are white.

original: g-yon du rdo rje sngon po dang / tho ba dang / gri gug dang / yang gri gug rnams dkar po'o //
analyzed: g-yon du rdo rje sngon po dang / tho ba dang / gri gug dang / yang gri gug rnams dkar po'o //
translated: To the left, the blue vajra, hammer, flaying knife, and another flaying knife are white.

original: de ltar mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'dod yon la yang go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma sum cu rtsa drug sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'dod yon la yang go bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the thirty-six signs should be understood as the sense objects of the body mandala.

original: de nas h'um yig dang / yi ge drug pa bzlas shing bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa dri'i chus dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol byugs nas de nyid bzlas shing chus dkyil 'khor la bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas h'um yig dang / yi ge drug pa bzlas shing bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa dri'i chus dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol byugs nas de nyid bzlas shing chus dkyil 'khor la bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the six-syllable mantra together with the five elixirs, anoint the outer area of the mandala with scented water. Reciting that mantra, sprinkle the mandala with water.

original: de nas tshon rnams kyi lhag ma'i ye shes pa aom a'a:h'um badzra mu: zhes brjod de gshegs su gsol ba dang / 'du 'dzi med pa'i sa ru gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tshon rnams kyi lhag ma'i ye shes pa aom a'a:h'um badzra mu: zhes brjod de gshegs su gsol ba dang / 'du 'dzi med pa'i sa ru gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, the remaining awareness beings of the colors are requested to depart with “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ,” and they should be placed in a place free of dust.

original: 'di ni tshon dgye ba'i cho ga'i rim pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni tshon dgye ba'i cho ga'i rim pa'o /
translated: This is the procedure for the lines of color.

original: // / de nas sngon du lhag par gnas par byas pa'i bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su bzhi gzhag go //
analyzed: // / de nas sngon du lhag par gnas par byas pa'i bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su bzhi gzhag go //
translated: Then, the vases that were previously empowered are placed in the east and so forth of the mandala.

original: yang nub tu rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa lnga'o //
analyzed: yang nub tu rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa lnga'o //
translated: Again, in the west, there are five vases of total victory.

original: shar du rgyal ba'i bum pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: shar du rgyal ba'i bum pa drug pa'o //
translated: In the east, there are six vases of victory.

original: de'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung ngo zhes pa ni bum pa drug gi phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung ngo zhes pa ni bum pa drug gi phyogs so //
translated: Above that, there is a great victory conch. This is the section of the six vases.

original: bum pa bcu'i phyogs ltar na phyogs mtshams brgyad du brgyad dang nub kyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg par rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa bcu'i phyogs ltar na phyogs mtshams brgyad du brgyad dang nub kyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg par rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'o //
translated: According to the section of the ten vases, there are eight in the eight directions and outside of the western vase, without touching it by two fingerbreadths, there is the vase of total victory.

original: shar gyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg par rgyal ba'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi bum pa'i phyi rol du sor gnyis kyis ma reg par rgyal ba'i bum pa'o //
translated: Outside of the eastern vase, without touching it by two fingerbreadths, there is the vase of victory.

original: de'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i dung bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Above that, there is the great victory conch, the eleventh.

original: de yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang las thams cad pa la dung ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang las thams cad pa la dung ngo //
translated: Moreover, for pacifying, increasing, and all activities, there is a conch.

original: gdug pa'i las thams cad la thod pa'o //
analyzed: gdug pa'i las thams cad la thod pa'o //
translated: For all violent actions, a skull cup.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la zangs dang gser ro //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la zangs dang gser ro //
translated: For enthralling and summoning, copper and gold.

original: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la kham phor ro //
analyzed: rengs pa dang rmongs pa la kham phor ro //
translated: For paralyzing and confusing, an earthenware pot.

original: de nas las dang mtshungs pa'i gos dang skud pas mgrin par dkri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas las dang mtshungs pa'i gos dang skud pas mgrin par dkri bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should tie around the neck [of the pot] a thread and cloth corresponding to the action.

original: bzhag pa 'di ni bum pa dgra ma pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bzhag pa 'di ni bum pa dgra ma pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the enemy-subduing pot.

original: de nas mtshams bzhi ru pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshams bzhi ru pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi bklag par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the four directions, one should recite the four [perfections], beginning with the perfection of generosity.

original: ga phur dang du ru ka dang aa ga rul sogs pa'i spos sna tshogs phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag go //
analyzed: ga phur dang du ru ka dang aa ga rul sogs pa'i spos sna tshogs phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag go //
translated: One should place various incense, such as camphor, durvā grass, and agarwood, in the eight directions.

original: sna tshogs pa'i gos dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan la sogs pa la gtso bo'i sngags dang / aom badzra spar na kham zhes pa'i sngags brjod @131a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gos dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan la sogs pa la gtso bo'i sngags dang / aom badzra spar na kham zhes pa'i sngags brjod @131a * //
translated: One should scatter various cloths, banners, flags, and so forth, reciting the mantra of the principal deity and the mantra Oṃ vajra sparśa khaṃ.

original: de ; rim pa bzhin gnas su dgram mo //
analyzed: de ; rim pa bzhin gnas su dgram mo //
translated: One should scatter them in the proper order.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i sgo rnams su rta babs la sna tshogs pa'i gos dang dril bu dang rnga yab rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i sgo rnams su rta babs la sna tshogs pa'i gos dang dril bu dang rnga yab rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The doors of the maṇḍala house are adorned with canopies, various cloths, and bells and yak-tail fans.

original: lo ma dang bcas pa'i chu shing gi ka ba dang gang ba'i bum pa kha rgyan dang bcas pa yang gzhag go //
analyzed: lo ma dang bcas pa'i chu shing gi ka ba dang gang ba'i bum pa kha rgyan dang bcas pa yang gzhag go //
translated: One should also place plantain tree pillars with leaves and vases filled with water and with mouth ornaments.

original: de nas slob dpon shar phyogs su bsdad la sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang / las rgyal mchog dang / thig le'i rnal 'byor dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams kyi cho ga byas la /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon shar phyogs su bsdad la sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang / las rgyal mchog dang / thig le'i rnal 'byor dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams kyi cho ga byas la /
translated: Then the master, sitting in the east, should perform the rite of the confession of sins and so forth as taught in the means of achievement, the protection wheel, the supreme royal maṇḍala, the supreme royal rite, the yoga of the drop, and the yoga of the subtle.

original: bcu drug lo nyid lon pa yi //
analyzed: bcu drug lo nyid lon pa yi //
translated: One should practice with a sixteen-year-old

original: btsun mo shin tu rab tu mdzes //
analyzed: btsun mo shin tu rab tu mdzes //
translated: queen who is very beautiful,

original: dri dang me tog dang ldan ma //
analyzed: dri dang me tog dang ldan ma //
translated: who is endowed with scent and flowers,🔽and who is well trained.

original: de nyid legs par bslabs pa dang // de yi dbus su 'dod pa bya //
analyzed: de nyid legs par bslabs pa dang // de yi dbus su 'dod pa bya //
translated: One should practice with her in the center.

original: yon tan rgya mtsho sna tshogs yum //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho sna tshogs yum //
translated: The mother is the ocean of various qualities.

original: sangs rgyas tshogs rnams spros pa dang // nam mkha'i khams su legs par brgyan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas tshogs rnams spros pa dang // nam mkha'i khams su legs par brgyan //
translated: The assembly of buddhas is well-adorned in the realm of space.

original: zhes pa rab tu gsungs pas phyi'i phyag rgya la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa rab tu gsungs pas phyi'i phyag rgya la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /
translated: Thus, one should enter into union with an external consort,

original: de ltar ma yin na ye shes kyi phyag rgya la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / sbyor ba'i sgras spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ye shes kyi phyag rgya la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / sbyor ba'i sgras spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: or, if that is not the case, one should enter into union with a gnosis consort, and with the word “join,” one should summon the gnosis wheel with the mantra jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,🔽invite them with the mantra, draw them in with the mantra, bind them with the mantra, and enthrall them with the mantra.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba rnams byas la zhabs bsil dang / yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song bas bdag nyid la gzhug par byas pa dang / chags pa chen pos zhu nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba rnams byas la zhabs bsil dang / yon chab la sogs pa sngon du song bas bdag nyid la gzhug par byas pa dang / chags pa chen pos zhu nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung ste /
translated: Having performed the preliminary of the foot-washing and the water for the mouth, and so on, one should enter into union with oneself, melt through great passion, and emerge from the path of the vajra.

original: lha mo'i padmar ye shes kyi 'khor lo spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i padmar ye shes kyi 'khor lo spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should emanate the wheel of gnosis into the lotus of the goddess.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor bsgoms te /
translated: Having meditated on the maṇḍala of colored powder,

original: gnas rnams kyi rim pas de rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas rnams kyi rim pas de rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: one should emanate them in the sequence of the places.

original: de nas snying ga'i sa bon las mchod pa'i lha mo rnams spros la phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sa bon las mchod pa'i lha mo rnams spros la phyi dang gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having emanated offering goddesses from the seed syllable at the heart, one should make offerings with outer and secret offerings.

original: mchod pa de'i rim pa ni //
analyzed: mchod pa de'i rim pa ni //
translated: The sequence of those offerings is as follows.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ

original: tree dh'a tu ke shva ra k'a la tsakra aa rgham pra t'i tstsha sa pa ri w'a r'a tv'am bha ga w'a na me wa ra do bha wa shishya nytsa /
analyzed: tree dh'a tu ke shva ra k'a la tsakra aa rgham pra t'i tstsha sa pa ri w'a r'a tv'am bha ga w'a na me wa ra do bha wa shishya nytsa /
translated: oṃ namo bhagavate trailokyavaṃśapati śrīvajraherabhattārakāya
