analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu ma nyams pa dang / lha bshos rnams snod du bzhag ste /
translated: unbroken flowers, fruits, and sacrificial cakes, and place them in vessels.

original: phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag go //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams brgyad du gzhag go //
translated: Place them in the eight directions.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa sngon du song bas stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bdag nyid kyis bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la yon chab sngon du song bas /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa sngon du song bas stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bdag nyid kyis bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo la yon chab sngon du song bas /
translated: Then, the master, having previously meditated on the protection wheel, after emptiness, the awareness wheel invited by the light rays of the seed syllable in oneself, having first offered drinking water,

original: thugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: should enter the mind and so forth maṇḍala.

original: de rnams kyang lha'i gzugs su bsgoms la de nas slob dpon gyis sngon du song ba'i dam tshig gi rdzas dang / stobs dang myos byed dang zan la sogs pa sngon du bzhag la gtor ma sbyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lha'i gzugs su bsgoms la de nas slob dpon gyis sngon du song ba'i dam tshig gi rdzas dang / stobs dang myos byed dang zan la sogs pa sngon du bzhag la gtor ma sbyang ngo //
translated: Having visualized those as the forms of deities, then the master having gone before, the pledge substances, the intoxicants, the food, and so forth, having been previously arranged, the sacrificial cake is purified.🔽Or, another system of purification is:

original: yang na sbyang lugs gzhan ni aom badzra kro dhe shva ri sarba dra by'a ni bi sho dha ya h'um phat /
analyzed: yang na sbyang lugs gzhan ni aom badzra kro dhe shva ri sarba dra by'a ni bi sho dha ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra krodha īśvara sarva dravyāṇi viśodhaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pas bdud rtsi lnga myos byed kyis bzhu bar bya ste bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: ces pas bdud rtsi lnga myos byed kyis bzhu bar bya ste bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: Having melted the five ambrosias with the intoxicant, one should sprinkle.

original: de nas srin lag gis blangs nas gru gsum byas pa'i dbus su mandala zlum po byas la de la ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: de nas srin lag gis blangs nas gru gsum byas pa'i dbus su mandala zlum po byas la de la ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drang ngo //
translated: Then, having taken with the ring finger, one should make a round maṇḍala in the center of the triangle, and invite the wheel of pristine consciousness.

original: de nas srin lag gis blangs la sngon du song ba'i sngags kyis yang dag par mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas srin lag gis blangs la sngon du song ba'i sngags kyis yang dag par mnyes par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken with the ring finger, one should please with the previously employed mantra.

original: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: Then, one should confess evil deeds and so forth.

original: 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba gdab par byas nas gshegs su gsol bar byas te //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don la gsol ba gdab par byas nas gshegs su gsol bar byas te //
translated: Having made a supplication for the desired aim, one should request [the deities] to depart.

original: de nas zhing skyong rnams la sngon du song ba'i sngags kyis gtor ma byin la /
analyzed: de nas zhing skyong rnams la sngon du song ba'i sngags kyis gtor ma byin la /
translated: Then, having given the sacrificial cake to the field protectors with the previously mentioned mantra,

original: de nas aom h'a ri ti pi na di kam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de nas aom h'a ri ti pi na di kam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: one should give the sacrificial cake to Hārītī and her messengers with the following mantras:🔽Oṃ, Hārītī, accept this sacrificial cake, svāhā.

original: aom d'u ti ke aa gra gr'a sa ma pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom d'u ti ke aa gra gr'a sa ma pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, Dūtike, Atikā, Gṛhadevatā, accept this sacrificial cake, svāhā.

original: zhes pas 'phrog ma dang pho nya dag la chang zan dang phud yi ge gsum mngon par bsngags te sa la bzhag la zas ma zos pa dang sbyin no //
analyzed: zhes pas 'phrog ma dang pho nya dag la chang zan dang phud yi ge gsum mngon par bsngags te sa la bzhag la zas ma zos pa dang sbyin no //
translated: Having consecrated the beer, the first portion, and the three syllables, one should give it to the ground and the one who has not eaten food.

original: de nas yon bdag gis mandala byas la ci bde bar gsol bar zhu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yon bdag gis mandala byas la ci bde bar gsol bar zhu zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, the patron should make a maṇḍala and request whatever is pleasing.

original: de nas las kyi rdo rjes bla ma la gus pas bag yod pas dam tshig gi rdzas de dang de rnams gus pa dang bcas pas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las kyi rdo rjes bla ma la gus pas bag yod pas dam tshig gi rdzas de dang de rnams gus pa dang bcas pas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the karma vajra should offer each of those substances of the sacred pledge to the guru with respect and heedfulness.

original: myos byed kyi snod padma'i phyag gis drang bar bya zhing lan pas kyang padma'i lag kor gyis so //
analyzed: myos byed kyi snod padma'i phyag gis drang bar bya zhing lan pas kyang padma'i lag kor gyis so //
translated: The vessel of the intoxicant should be held with the lotus hand and the reply should also be with the lotus hand.

original: slob dpon la thams cad nyis 'gyur du drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon la thams cad nyis 'gyur du drang bar bya'o //
translated: Everything should be doubled for the master.

original: de rnams kyis myos byed kyi phud dang po slob dpon la phul te phyag byas la btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis myos byed kyi phud dang po slob dpon la phul te phyag byas la btung bar bya'o //
translated: They should offer the first portion of the intoxicant to the master, bow down, and drink.

original: gnang ba ma byin gyi @146b bar du myos byed sa la mi gzhag cing sa la gzhag na gcig la gcig padma'i phyag gis drang zhing blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnang ba ma byin gyi @146b bar du myos byed sa la mi gzhag cing sa la gzhag na gcig la gcig padma'i phyag gis drang zhing blang bar bya'o //
translated: Without permission, one should not place the intoxicant on the ground, but if it is placed on the ground, one should pick it up with a lotus hand, taking it from one to the other.

original: de ltar stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa ldag pa dang btung ba dang bza' ba dang bca' ba rnams 'dren pa'i dus su de dag gis brjod pa /
analyzed: de ltar stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa ldag pa dang btung ba dang bza' ba dang bca' ba rnams 'dren pa'i dus su de dag gis brjod pa /
translated: In this way, when the time comes to serve the meat, intoxicants, and so on, to lick, drink, eat, and consume, they should say this:

original: chos rnams rang bzhin rnam par dag /'di la the tshom ma byed par //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin rnam par dag /'di la the tshom ma byed par //
translated: “The nature of phenomena is completely pure; do not doubt this.

original: bram ze khyi dang gdol pa rnams //
analyzed: bram ze khyi dang gdol pa rnams //
translated: Brahmins, dogs, and untouchables

original: rang bzhin gcig tu za bar gyis //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu za bar gyis //
translated: are of one nature when eaten.

original: bde gshegs chos rnams zag pa med //
analyzed: bde gshegs chos rnams zag pa med //
translated: The phenomena of the sugatas are uncontaminated,

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs dri ma med //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs dri ma med //
translated: equal to space, and stainless.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnams dang bral //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnams dang bral //
translated: Free from apprehended objects and apprehending subjects,

original: 'di la 'khrul pa med par skyabs //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul pa med par skyabs //
translated: this is the undeluded refuge.

original: gzhan yang / 'khor lo gtso bos ma gnang bas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'khor lo gtso bos ma gnang bas //
translated: Moreover,

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya ba min //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya ba min //
translated: One should not perform the ganacakra rite.

original: lha yi rnal 'byor ldan pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor ldan pa yis //
translated: The one who is endowed with the yoga of the deity

original: bya ba thams cad dal gyis bya //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad dal gyis bya //
translated: should do everything slowly.

original: gzhan du na rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be distraction.

original: 'gro bar 'dod na 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs pa la phyag byas te //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'dod na 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs pa la phyag byas te //
translated: When one wishes to go, one should pay homage to the principal of the maṇḍala and so forth,

original: gnang bzhu la'o //
analyzed: gnang bzhu la'o //
translated: and request permission.

original: 'jug pa'i dus su phyag byas la'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i dus su phyag byas la'o //
translated: At the time of entering, one should pay homage.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pas longs spyad do //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pas longs spyad do //
translated: Thus, one should enjoy while remaining in equipoise.

original: stobs dang myos byed la sogs pas shes pas bteg na bla ma las rjes gnang thob pa dang yid du 'ong ba'i rdo rje'i glu cung zad smad la blang ba ni lha de dang de'i phyag rgya dang gar dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: stobs dang myos byed la sogs pas shes pas bteg na bla ma las rjes gnang thob pa dang yid du 'ong ba'i rdo rje'i glu cung zad smad la blang ba ni lha de dang de'i phyag rgya dang gar dang bcas pas so //
translated: If one is lifted by the power of alcohol and so forth, one should slightly sing a pleasing vajra song, having obtained permission from the guru, with the mudra and dance of that and that deity.

original: de nas stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byas pa dang so so'i gnas na gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / zur gyi mig gis bsdus pa'i lta bas blta bar bya zhing mtho la mkhregs pa'i nu ma dang padma reg cing mchu gzhib cing 'khrud pa la sogs pa'i ka ra na'i bye brag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byas pa dang so so'i gnas na gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams dang / zur gyi mig gis bsdus pa'i lta bas blta bar bya zhing mtho la mkhregs pa'i nu ma dang padma reg cing mchu gzhib cing 'khrud pa la sogs pa'i ka ra na'i bye brag bya'o //
translated: Then, having eaten and drunk the food and drink such as the strength-bestowing and intoxicating substances, and so on, one should look with sidelong glances at the yoginis who are in their own places, and one should do the various things of karaṇa, such as touching the breasts and lotus of one who is tall and firm, and licking and sucking the lips, and so on.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi tha dad kyi ngo tsha dang rigs dang / rigs min la sogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa spangs te /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi tha dad kyi ngo tsha dang rigs dang / rigs min la sogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa spangs te /
translated: Here, one should abandon the various thoughts of shame, caste, and non-caste, and so on, of the yoginis.

original: so so'i gnas na gnas pa'i sring mo la sogs pa sna dang / rna ba dang mchu la sogs pa chad pa dang / gzugs dan pa la sogs pa de ru 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i gnas na gnas pa'i sring mo la sogs pa sna dang / rna ba dang mchu la sogs pa chad pa dang / gzugs dan pa la sogs pa de ru 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: The yogins and yoginis who have assembled there should not abandon the sister, and so on, who is in her own place, even if she has a cut nose, ear, or lip, or an ugly form, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: The yogins and yoginis should not abandon her.

original: de yang lang tsho ma gang zhig autpala'i spyan dang ldan pas slob dpon dang dpa' bo rnams dang bcas pa'i rdo rje la mchod par byed na /
analyzed: de yang lang tsho ma gang zhig autpala'i spyan dang ldan pas slob dpon dang dpa' bo rnams dang bcas pa'i rdo rje la mchod par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if a young woman with eyes like a blue lotus makes offerings to the vajra together with the master and the heroes,

original: de'i bsod nams ni sa gzhi dang glang po che dang / rta dang / phu mo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa phul ba bas kyang bsod nams che'o //🔽'dir rnal 'byor @147a * //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ni sa gzhi dang glang po che dang / rta dang / phu mo la sogs pa dpag tu med pa phul ba bas kyang bsod nams che'o // 'dir rnal 'byor @147a * //
translated: her merit is greater than if she were to offer an immeasurable amount of land, elephants, horses, and cows.

original: ma rnams kyi phyag dang mtshan ma dang // rigs kyi dbye ba la sogs pa gzhung ches kyis dogs pas ma bris so //🔽de nas stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa la longs spyod la de ltar thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: ma rnams kyi phyag dang mtshan ma dang // rigs kyi dbye ba la sogs pa gzhung ches kyis dogs pas ma bris so // de nas stobs dang myos byed la sogs pa la longs spyod la de ltar thams cad bya ste /
translated: Here, the hand gestures, signs, divisions of families, and so forth of the yoginīs are not written due to fear of being too wordy.🔽Then, one should enjoy the wine, meat, and so forth.

original: rdzogs pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa'i lhag ma sleb dpon gyis sdud du bcug la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa'i lhag ma sleb dpon gyis sdud du bcug la /
translated: All of that having been done, the master should collect the leftovers of the completed eating and drinking,

original: mdun du bzhag pa la slar yang myos byed la sogs pa blugs te /
analyzed: mdun du bzhag pa la slar yang myos byed la sogs pa blugs te /
translated: and having placed them in front, one should again pour the wine, and so forth.

original: sngags gsum gyis mngon par byin gyis brlabs pa'i chang gi kha phru btab la /
analyzed: sngags gsum gyis mngon par byin gyis brlabs pa'i chang gi kha phru btab la /
translated: One should sprinkle the remnants with wine consecrated with the three syllables.

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
translated: Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi,

original: au tstshi shta ba l'i autstshi shta bhaksha ka sv'a h'a /
analyzed: au tstshi shta ba l'i autstshi shta bhaksha ka sv'a h'a /
translated: ucchiṣṭavāle ucchiṣṭabhakṣa svāhā.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis lhag ma'i gtor ma la ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis lhag ma'i gtor ma la ste /
translated: With this mantra, the remainder torma is offered.

original: mar me dang bcas pa phyi log su gtong du bzhug go //
analyzed: mar me dang bcas pa phyi log su gtong du bzhug go //
translated: Together with the lamps, it is taken outside.

original: de nas gos zung dang / lag gdub dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa dri zhim po dang bcas pa'i so rtsi la sogs pa gtso bo dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo la sogs pa rnams la 'bul lo //
analyzed: de nas gos zung dang / lag gdub dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa dri zhim po dang bcas pa'i so rtsi la sogs pa gtso bo dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo la sogs pa rnams la 'bul lo //
translated: Then, one should offer to the principal, heroes, heroines, and so forth, a tooth stick and so forth, together with perfume, a pair of garments, bracelets, earrings, and so forth.

original: de nas mandala byas te brjod pa /
analyzed: de nas mandala byas te brjod pa /
translated: Then, having made a maṇḍala, one should recite:🔽By this merit, may sentient beings dwelling in the three realms, innumerable, attain the unsurpassed.

original: bsod nams 'di yis sems can grangs med khams gsum la gnas rnams kyis bla na med pa thob par shog / ces pas yon gyi bdag pos smon lam gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis sems can grangs med khams gsum la gnas rnams kyis bla na med pa thob par shog / ces pas yon gyi bdag pos smon lam gdab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the patron should make aspirations.

original: de nas lhag ma lus pa dong du sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lhag ma lus pa dong du sba bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the remainder should be buried in a pit.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor los bdag rgyal po'am gzhan gyis bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi 'khor los bdag rgyal po'am gzhan gyis bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the wheel of the gaṇacakra is performed by the king or another.

original: de las gzhan pa ni cho ga pa'i bye brag ji ltar rnyed pa'i tha ma la ma'i bud med dam skyes pa rnams las lnga'am bcu gsum mam /🔽nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni cho ga pa'i bye brag ji ltar rnyed pa'i tha ma la ma'i bud med dam skyes pa rnams las lnga'am bcu gsum mam / nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
translated: The other is the five, thirteen or twenty one women or men of the caste of the officiating priest, obtained in whatever way is appropriate.🔽🔽

original: rtsa dgu'am / yongs su rdzogs pa la snyan gsan phab ste /
analyzed: rtsa dgu'am / yongs su rdzogs pa la snyan gsan phab ste /
translated: Other than that, one should invite the five, thirteen, twenty-one, twenty-nine, or the complete number of women or men, whichever is available, as one’s mother, and so on, according to the particular rite.

original: ji lhar rnyed pa'i gdan la sogs pa de ltar thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: ji lhar rnyed pa'i gdan la sogs pa de ltar thams cad bya'o //
translated: One should do all of that, such as the seat, and so on, as much as is available.

original: de nas dpa' bo'i ston mo ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na dbus ba lang gi lci bas gru bzhi pa byas te /
analyzed: de nas dpa' bo'i ston mo ni rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor med na dbus ba lang gi lci bas gru bzhi pa byas te /
translated: Then, in the feast of the hero, if there is no maṇḍala of colored powder, one should make a square in the center with cow dung.

original: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs pa la sogs pa /
translated: Then, having invited the wheel of pristine consciousness, and so on,

original: slob dpon gyis snga ma ltar byas la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis snga ma ltar byas la /
translated: the master should do as before.

original: de yang tshogs kyi gtso bo kha shar du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tshogs kyi gtso bo kha shar du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the chief of the gaṇas should face east.

original: de'i g-yon du phyag rgya gcig yon bdag gis dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i g-yon du phyag rgya gcig yon bdag gis dbul bar bya'o //
translated: To his left, the consort should be offered by the patron.

original: gzhan du na phyag rgya dang bral ba'i chang gi btung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na phyag rgya dang bral ba'i chang gi btung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it is prohibited to drink alcohol without a consort.

original: de'i g-yas phyogs su slob dpon dge slong rnams ni gral shar du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs su slob dpon dge slong rnams ni gral shar du phyogs pas so //
translated: To the right of that, the master monks should sit in a row facing east.

original: bden bral nas slob dpon dge tshul rnams byang du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: bden bral nas slob dpon dge tshul rnams byang du phyogs pas so //
translated: From the southwest, the master novices should sit facing north.

original: dbang ldan nas slob dpon khyim pa rnams kha lho ru phyogs pas so //
analyzed: dbang ldan nas slob dpon khyim pa rnams kha lho ru phyogs pas so //
translated: From the northeast, the master householders should sit facing south.

original: de ltar dge slong ma dang dge tshul @147b ma dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong ma dang dge tshul @147b ma dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the nuns, novices, and laywomen should also sit.

original: tshogs kyi gtso mo'i g-yon du thabs cig yon bdag gis dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi gtso mo'i g-yon du thabs cig yon bdag gis dbul bar bya'o //
translated: To the left of the chief of the assembly, the patron should sit alone.

original: gzhan du na thabs dang bral ba'i stobs kyis bza' ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na thabs dang bral ba'i stobs kyis bza' ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, because eating without a method is prohibited.

original: lhag ma snga ma dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma snga ma dang mtshungs so //
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: 'di ni dpa' bo'i ston mo dang bcas pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dpa' bo'i ston mo dang bcas pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the ritual of the gaṇacakra together with the feast of heroes.

original: de nas gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor ram bris sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas lugs ma la sogs pa rab tu gnas pa bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor ram bris sku la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du song bas lugs ma la sogs pa rab tu gnas pa bya ba ni /
translated: Then, having made offerings and so forth to the maṇḍala as taught, or to a maṇḍala of a painted image, and so forth, the consecration of the statue, and so forth, is performed.

original: stong ba'i dang las sa bon la sogs pa las yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: stong ba'i dang las sa bon la sogs pa las yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
translated: From the emptiness of the syllable taṃ, the seed syllable, and so forth, the complete [form] arises,

original: skad cig gis dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs thugs kar sa bon dang bcas pa bsams la /
analyzed: skad cig gis dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs thugs kar sa bon dang bcas pa bsams la /
translated: or the form of the pledge being with the seed syllable at the heart is imagined in an instant.

original: na bza' gsar ba dmar po la sogs pa bskon pa dang / de nas yon bdag me tog dang dang bcas pa de nyid gzugs brnyan me tog dang bcas par dmigs te /
analyzed: na bza' gsar ba dmar po la sogs pa bskon pa dang / de nas yon bdag me tog dang dang bcas pa de nyid gzugs brnyan me tog dang bcas par dmigs te /
translated: The new red clothes, and so forth, are put on, and then the patron, together with the flowers, is imagined as the reflection together with the flowers.

original: yon bdag lugs ma sogs pa dang bcas pas slob ma ji lta ba bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yon bdag lugs ma sogs pa dang bcas pas slob ma ji lta ba bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The patron, together with the statue, and so forth, enters the maṇḍala of colored powder just as the disciples did.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang lugs ma la sogs pa'i lhag pa'i lha'i mtshan ma 'am de'i rigs kyi mtshan ma la de'i me tog gi phreng ba 'bul du gzhug go //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang lugs ma la sogs pa'i lhag pa'i lha'i mtshan ma 'am de'i rigs kyi mtshan ma la de'i me tog gi phreng ba 'bul du gzhug go //
translated: The master should also cause the flower garland to be offered to the sign of the excellent deity, such as the statue, and so forth, or to the sign of its type.

original: yang na me tog dor ba sngangs te /
analyzed: yang na me tog dor ba sngangs te /
translated: Or else, having scattered flowers,

original: lugs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: lugs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should enter by merely seeing the maṇḍala of the statue, and so on.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi phyogs ma byang shar mtshams su khrus kyi gdan gyi snam bu chu dang zheng du ji ltar 'tsham par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi phyogs ma byang shar mtshams su khrus kyi gdan gyi snam bu chu dang zheng du ji ltar 'tsham par bya ba'am /
translated: Moreover, in the northeast corner of the east side of the maṇḍala, one should prepare a bathing platform, as wide as it is long,

original: ji lta ba bzhin dus gzhi la byugs pa la sogs byas pa la bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i ba'i rnam lngas byugs te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin dus gzhi la byugs pa la sogs byas pa la bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i ba'i rnam lngas byugs te /
translated: or just the right size, anointed with the five products of the cow mixed with the five elixirs,

original: phyogs mtshams la bum pa brgyad bkod pa dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dril bu dang / gar dang / glu dang / sgra la sogs pa ji ltar nus pa yid du 'ong bar byas la /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams la bum pa brgyad bkod pa dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dril bu dang / gar dang / glu dang / sgra la sogs pa ji ltar nus pa yid du 'ong bar byas la /
translated: and arranged with eight vases in the directions and corners, flowers, and so on, parasols, victory banners, flags, bells, dance, song, music, and so on, as much as one can, to make it pleasing.

original: dge ba'i tshes la sogs pa la slob dpon rgyan thams cad btags te /
analyzed: dge ba'i tshes la sogs pa la slob dpon rgyan thams cad btags te /
translated: On an auspicious day, and so on, the master, adorned with all ornaments,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rig ma dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal gyis /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rig ma dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal gyis /
translated: with the pride of Vajrasattva with his consort,

original: stegs bu'i dbus su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyi gru bzhi pa /
analyzed: stegs bu'i dbus su thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad kyi gru bzhi pa /
translated: In the center of the platform, one should draw with colored powder the square mandala of the mind,

original: rta babs dang bral ba'i nub kyi sgo dang ldan pa sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa phyogs dang mtshams rnams la don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan rnams rdul tshon gyis bya'o //🔽de'i steng du snam @148a * //
analyzed: rta babs dang bral ba'i nub kyi sgo dang ldan pa sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa phyogs dang mtshams rnams la don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan rnams rdul tshon gyis bya'o // de'i steng du snam @148a * //
translated: which is without archways and has a western door, and an eight-petaled multicolored lotus. In the directions and quarters, one should draw the names of Amoghasiddhi and so forth.

original: bul padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa la /
analyzed: bul padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris pa la /
translated: On top of that, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus on a cloth.

original: lugs ma la sogs pa bskyod par nus pa rnams shar du phyogs bas bzhugs su gsol lo //
analyzed: lugs ma la sogs pa bskyod par nus pa rnams shar du phyogs bas bzhugs su gsol lo //
translated: One should request the images and so forth that can be moved to sit facing east.

original: lha khang dang mchod rten du dri gtsang khang dang / lugs ma chen po rnams snga ma ltar dam tshig pa bskyed la dkyil 'khor du bzhugs par bsam pa ste /
analyzed: lha khang dang mchod rten du dri gtsang khang dang / lugs ma chen po rnams snga ma ltar dam tshig pa bskyed la dkyil 'khor du bzhugs par bsam pa ste /
translated: In a temple or stūpa, in the fragrant chamber, and in the great images, one should generate the pledge beings as before and imagine them residing in the mandala.

original: de rnams la khrus kyi sna ma bu dgos pa med pas na de ltar bye brag gnyis so //
analyzed: de rnams la khrus kyi sna ma bu dgos pa med pas na de ltar bye brag gnyis so //
translated: Since those do not need a bathing platform, there are two specific cases.

original: de yang nub mo'i dus su lugs ma la sogs pa sngon du bzhugs pa dang / de la bdag nyid mngon par phyogs te zhabs bsil la sogs sngon du song bas nir man tshan bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang nub mo'i dus su lugs ma la sogs pa sngon du bzhugs pa dang / de la bdag nyid mngon par phyogs te zhabs bsil la sogs sngon du song bas nir man tshan bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, at night time, the image, etc. are placed in front, and oneself, having first performed the washing of the feet, etc. , performs the rite with the mantra.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho ham ksha:/
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho ham ksha:/
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ ho haṃ kṣaḥ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis grub pa'i yungs kar chang ba g-yas g-yon du gzung la so sor lan gnyis su g-yon du bskor zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis grub pa'i yungs kar chang ba g-yas g-yon du gzung la so sor lan gnyis su g-yon du bskor zhing /
translated: Holding the consecrated mustard seed in the right and left hand, one should turn it around twice to the left with each mantra.

original: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya badzra sa tva sya sarba p'a pam da ha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya badzra sa tva sya sarba p'a pam da ha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, burn, burn all sins with the vajra of the Vajrasattva, all sins, svāhā.

original: zhes pa bzlas te yungs kar me la gdegs par bya'o //🔽de ltar g-yas su bskor bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa bzlas te yungs kar me la gdegs par bya'o // de ltar g-yas su bskor bas kyang ngo //
translated: Reciting this, one should cast the mustard seed into the fire.🔽In the same way, one should turn it around to the right with the mantra, Oṃ, burn, burn all sins with the vajra of the Vajrasattva, all sins, svāhā.🔽Having filled a trough or a basin with water, one should heat it with cow dung cakes, and with the mantra, Oṃ, burn, burn all sins with the vajra of the Vajrasattva, all sins, svāhā,

original: de ltar chus gang ba'i kham por dang d'ur ba dang bcas pa'i ba lang gi lci bas chang bar bcangs la chang zan dang / gsil ya ba ras rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar chus gang ba'i kham por dang d'ur ba dang bcas pa'i ba lang gi lci bas chang bar bcangs la chang zan dang / gsil ya ba ras rnams te /
translated: one should heat the water with a fire of chaff, etc.

original: 'on kyang kha 'phor la sogs pa me ru skyur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha 'phor la sogs pa me ru skyur bar mi bya'o //
translated: However, one should not throw the trough, etc. into the fire.

original: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa la lag pas reg la /
analyzed: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa la lag pas reg la /
translated: Then, touch the image, etc., with your hand.

original: gtso bo'i sngags dang bcas pas lugs ma la sogs pa la ji ltar rigs pa ltar dngos su 'am me long gi gzugs brnyan la dri ni thugs kar byug go //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sngags dang bcas pas lugs ma la sogs pa la ji ltar rigs pa ltar dngos su 'am me long gi gzugs brnyan la dri ni thugs kar byug go //
translated: Anoint the image, etc., with the principal mantra, either directly or in the reflection of a mirror, according to what is appropriate.

original: me tog ni dbu la'o //
analyzed: me tog ni dbu la'o //
translated: Place the flower on the head.

original: yon chab mdun du'o //
analyzed: yon chab mdun du'o //
translated: Place the water for the feet in front.

original: mar me bskor bzhin pas so //
analyzed: mar me bskor bzhin pas so //
translated: Carry the lamp around.

original: mar dang sbos dkar yi ge drug pa lan bdun bzlas te bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: mar dang sbos dkar yi ge drug pa lan bdun bzlas te bdug par bya'o //
translated: Anoint with clarified butter and white sugar, repeating the six-syllable mantra seven times.

original: 'di ni nir man tsha na'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nir man tsha na'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the nirmanacitta.

original: de nas yi ge drug pa bzlas shing d'u ra ba'i pir gyis zangs kyi snod na gnas pa'i zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / ka ra rnams te /
analyzed: de nas yi ge drug pa bzlas shing d'u ra ba'i pir gyis zangs kyi snod na gnas pa'i zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / ka ra rnams te /
translated: Then, while reciting the six-syllable mantra, with a brush of durva grass, take curd, milk, butter, honey, and sugar from a copper vessel,

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan yang zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / chu rnams kyis lugs ma la sogs pa sku khrus gsol du btub pa rnams la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i bdag nyid dang / gzhan yang zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / chu rnams kyis lugs ma la sogs pa sku khrus gsol du btub pa rnams la /
translated: which are the nature of the five nectars, and also curd, milk, butter, cow dung, and water, and bathe the images, etc., that can be bathed.

original: aom h'um tr'am hr'i: aa /
analyzed: aom h'um tr'am hr'i: aa /
translated: Oṃ hūṃ traṃ hrīḥ aḥ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis byug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis byug par bya'o //
translated: With this mantra one should anoint.

original: bris sku dang po ti la sogs pa rnams me long gi gzugs brnyan la'o //
analyzed: bris sku dang po ti la sogs pa rnams me long gi gzugs brnyan la'o //
translated: For painted images, books, and so forth, it is done in a mirror image.

original: de nas yi ge drug pa bzla zhing chu gtsang ma dang dri zhim bos khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yi ge drug pa bzla zhing chu gtsang ma dang dri zhim bos khrus bya'o //
translated: Then, reciting the six-syllable mantra, one should bathe with clean water and fragrant scents.

original: de nas khar ba'i snod du 'dag chal lnga blugs pas dag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas khar ba'i snod du 'dag chal lnga blugs pas dag par bya ba ni /
translated: Then, in a copper vessel, one should purify with the five cleansing substances.

original: @148b aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: @148b aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya bi sho dha ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ sarvatathāgata kāya viśodhani svāhā.

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: With this mantra.

original: me dang nyi mas smin pa'i dri'i mar gyis byugs la yang 'dag chal gyis so //
analyzed: me dang nyi mas smin pa'i dri'i mar gyis byugs la yang 'dag chal gyis so //
translated: Anointed with ghee ripened by fire and the sun, one should again cleanse with the five cleansing substances.

original: skyur pos byugs la de ltar khrus byas te /
analyzed: skyur pos byugs la de ltar khrus byas te /
translated: Anointed with sour substances, one should bathe in that way.

original: khar ba'i snod kyi yung bas byugs nas yang khrus bya'o //
analyzed: khar ba'i snod kyi yung bas byugs nas yang khrus bya'o //
translated: Anointed with turmeric in a copper vessel, one should bathe again.

original: de nas tsandan dang / gur gum dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi la sogs pas mnyam par byugs te /
analyzed: de nas tsandan dang / gur gum dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi la sogs pas mnyam par byugs te /
translated: Then, anointed with an equal mixture of sandalwood, saffron, camphor, musk, and so forth,

original: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i bum pas khrus byed par bsam zhing bkra shis kyi glu dang bcas pas bum pa rnams kyi chu yis khrus bya ba ni /🔽sngon du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis spyan drangs pa'i bum pas khrus byed par bsam zhing bkra shis kyi glu dang bcas pas bum pa rnams kyi chu yis khrus bya ba ni / sngon du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: With the song of auspiciousness, the water of the vases performs the bathing.

original: de nyid la chags pa'i chu ras 'jam pos dbyi bar byas la de la ji ltar nus pa'i na bza' dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la chags pa'i chu ras 'jam pos dbyi bar byas la de la ji ltar nus pa'i na bza' dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With the verse previously mentioned, wipe the water off with a soft cloth.

original: de nas sa bon gyis ye shes sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha rnams mdun du spyan drangs la zhabs bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / yon chab rnams sngon du song bas bus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas sa bon gyis ye shes sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha rnams mdun du spyan drangs la zhabs bsil dang / zhal bsil dang / yon chab rnams sngon du song bas bus mo g-yas pa sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then, having invited the awareness beings, the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and deities with the seed syllable, having gone before them with the washing of the feet, the washing of the face, and the offering of water, kneel on the right knee,🔽ring the bell with the left hand, and with the right hand hold the incense burner and recite:

original: lag pa g-yon pas dril bu dkrol zhing g-yas pas spos snod kyis bdug cing h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i lce dang ldan pas /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas dril bu dkrol zhing g-yas pas spos snod kyis bdug cing h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje'i lce dang ldan pas /
translated: With the vajra tongue that arises from hūṃ,

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo nyid ces pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo nyid ces pa /
translated: The Blessed One is the Wheel of Time itself.

original: bdag ni rdo rje che ge nyid //
analyzed: bdag ni rdo rje che ge nyid //
translated: I am the great vajra himself.

original: ces par bsgyur bas bstod de /
analyzed: ces par bsgyur bas bstod de /
translated: Thus, having praised,

original: phyag byas nas /
analyzed: phyag byas nas /
translated: having made obeisance,

original: aom badzra pu na r'a ga ma na ya mu:/
analyzed: aom badzra pu na r'a ga ma na ya mu:/
translated: with Om vajra pu na ra ga ma na ya muh,

original: zhes pas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: zhes pas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: one should request departure.

original: khrus byas pa'i lugs ma la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas lnga rnams la dris byugs la mchod de /
analyzed: khrus byas pa'i lugs ma la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas lnga rnams la dris byugs la mchod de /
translated: Having anointed with saffron the five places of the images and so forth that have been bathed, one should make offerings.

original: yi ge drug pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas kyi rdo rje lan gsum du reg nas lha de dang de'i bsngags bzlas te /
analyzed: yi ge drug pa dang bcas pa'i g-yas kyi rdo rje lan gsum du reg nas lha de dang de'i bsngags bzlas te /
translated: Having touched the vajra on the right, together with the six-syllable mantra, three times, one should recite the praises of that and that deity.

original: de nas phyogs skyong rnams la gtor ma dbul lo zhes pas so //
analyzed: de nas phyogs skyong rnams la gtor ma dbul lo zhes pas so //
translated: Then, one should offer sacrificial cakes to the guardians of the directions.

original: gang zhig sems can brtan na lhag par gnas pa med kyang rab tu gnas par bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can brtan na lhag par gnas pa med kyang rab tu gnas par bya ba ni /
translated: If one is not able to perform the consecration of a sentient being, one should perform the consecration of a receptacle,

original: gsungs par 'gyur pa'i cho ga rnams nyi ma gcig la bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs par 'gyur pa'i cho ga rnams nyi ma gcig la bya'o //
translated: and one should perform the rites that will be explained in one day.

original: yon bdag la 'byor pa yod na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: yon bdag la 'byor pa yod na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: If the patron has the means, one should perform the consecration for the sake of the accumulation of merit.

original: 'di ni lha lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the consecration of the deity.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs kyi gzhi la sgo bzhi pa re kh'a lnga dang bcas pa byas la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs kyi gzhi la sgo bzhi pa re kh'a lnga dang bcas pa byas la /
translated: Then, on the ground to the east of the mandala, one should draw a four-doored palace with five lines,

original: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'o //
translated: with an eight-petaled lotus in the center.

original: phyogs dang mtshams rnams su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin mtshan ma rnams dgod do //
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshams rnams su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin mtshan ma rnams dgod do //
translated: In the directions and quarters, one should arrange the symbols in the proper order.

original: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor @149a * //
analyzed: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor @149a * //
translated: Then, with the image, etc.

original: la sngon du phyogs pas zhugs pa dang / rgyud dang sgrub thabs la sogs par lha bskyed pa'i bye brag slob dpon gyis go bar bya ste /🔽mchod rten la sogs pa stong ba'i dang las rim pas sam /
analyzed: la sngon du phyogs pas zhugs pa dang / rgyud dang sgrub thabs la sogs par lha bskyed pa'i bye brag slob dpon gyis go bar bya ste / mchod rten la sogs pa stong ba'i dang las rim pas sam /
translated: facing toward the mandala, one should enter, and the master should understand the distinctions in the generation of the deity according to the tantras, the means of achievement, etc.

original: skad cig gis dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs bsgom mo //
analyzed: skad cig gis dam tshig sems dpa'i gzugs bsgom mo //
translated: In the case of a stupa, etc., one should visualize the pledge-being form by the process of the sequence of emptiness or instantly.

original: po ti rnams ni stong pa'i dang las a'a: de las 'od dpag tu med pa'i rig ma dang bcas pa padma dang nyi ma'i steng du'o //
analyzed: po ti rnams ni stong pa'i dang las a'a: de las 'od dpag tu med pa'i rig ma dang bcas pa padma dang nyi ma'i steng du'o //
translated: In the case of the books, from the state of emptiness, an āḥ becomes an Amitābha with his knowledge consort upon a lotus and sun.

original: de yang yongs su gyur pa las yi ge'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid 'od dpag med kyi gzugs kyi dam tshig pa du bsgom /
analyzed: de yang yongs su gyur pa las yi ge'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid 'od dpag med kyi gzugs kyi dam tshig pa du bsgom /
translated: Furthermore, from the complete transformation, meditate on the pledge being of the form of Amitābha, whose nature is the reflection of the syllable.

original: lha khang dang / mchod rten dang / dri'i gtsang khang la sogs pa rnams padma dang zla pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: lha khang dang / mchod rten dang / dri'i gtsang khang la sogs pa rnams padma dang zla pa la gnas pa /
translated: The temple, stūpa, fragrant shrine, and so on, are on a lotus and moon.

original: aom las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma la 'khyud pa yongs su gyur pa las lha khang la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs kyi dam tshig sems dpa' ru bsgom mo //
analyzed: aom las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad spyan ma la 'khyud pa yongs su gyur pa las lha khang la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs kyi dam tshig sems dpa' ru bsgom mo //
translated: From oṃ, meditate on the pledge being of the form of Vairocana, whose nature is the reflection of the temple, and so on, the complete transformation of Vairocana embracing Buddhalocanā.

original: gzhan yang stong ba'i rang bzhin du ni byas nas rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang stong ba'i rang bzhin du ni byas nas rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams //
translated: Furthermore, having made the nature of emptiness, the vajra of body, speech, and mind of the supreme victors,

original: zhes pas sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i tshogs bdag nyid dus kyi 'khor lor bsgom zhing /
analyzed: zhes pas sgrub thabs su gsungs pa'i tshogs bdag nyid dus kyi 'khor lor bsgom zhing /
translated: the lord of the gaṇas is taught in the sādhana to meditate on the Wheel of Time.

original: lha la sogs pa rnams kyang so so'i sa bon las byung ba'i so so'i gzugs kyi rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa rnams kyang so so'i sa bon las byung ba'i so so'i gzugs kyi rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Also, the gods and so forth are meditated in the form of their individual seed syllables.

original: zla ba dkar po la sogs pa nas nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor ljang gu'i bar dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i bar du bkod la aom nas ksha:'i bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dkar po la sogs pa nas nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor ljang gu'i bar dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i bar du bkod la aom nas ksha:'i bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From the white moon and so forth up to the green maṇḍala of the sky, they are arranged from the forehead cakra and so forth up to the secret place.

original: lha rnams kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The gods are as follows:

original: rang gi sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
translated: The wisdom wheel is invoked by the light rays of one’s seed syllable.

original: zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod la /
analyzed: zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod la /
translated: Make offerings with the foot-washing water, and so on.

original: dza h'um bam ho: zhes pa brjod de lcags kyu'i phyag rgyal sogs pas khro bo bzhi yis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba rnams rim pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: dza h'um bam ho: zhes pa brjod de lcags kyu'i phyag rgyal sogs pas khro bo bzhi yis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba rnams rim pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Recite jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, and with the hook and so on, the four wrathful ones summon, induct, bind, and control in sequence.

original: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa rnams snying ga'i padmar nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar gyi nang du sa bon gyi yi ge dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lugs ma la sogs pa rnams snying ga'i padmar nyi ma dang zla ba kha sbyar gyi nang du sa bon gyi yi ge dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the heart lotuses of the statues and so on, one should arrange the seed syllables inside the joined sun and moon.

original: de nas chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams sngon du gsungs pa'i slob ma la dbang bskur ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas chu la sogs pa'i dbang rnams sngon du gsungs pa'i slob ma la dbang bskur ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Then, the empowerments of water and so forth, as previously explained, are conferred on the disciple.

original: yang na bsgoms pas thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsgoms pas thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Or else, by means of meditation, everything is completed.

original: gzhan yang dbang bskur ba spangs la thugs kang sa bon bkod pa dang / lnga'i gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs su nges par bltas la rang gi sngags sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang bskur ba spangs la thugs kang sa bon bkod pa dang / lnga'i gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs su nges par bltas la rang gi sngags sam /
translated: Moreover, having abandoned the conferral of empowerment, one should visualize the seed syllable and the form of the five images, and offer with one's own mantra,

original: sngags 'dis mchod pa ni /
analyzed: sngags 'dis mchod pa ni /
translated: or with this mantra:

original: aom @149b a'a: badzra wa stra ye h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom @149b a'a: badzra wa stra ye h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra-vase Hūṃ svāhā.

original: zhes pa dang / de ltar aom a'a: badzra dang por brjod cing h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de ltar aom a'a: badzra dang por brjod cing h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Thus, having uttered Oṃ āḥ vajra at the beginning, and having applied Hūṃ svāhā at the end,

original: mtha' mar sbyar pa'i sngags rnams kyis me tog dang / bdug sbos dang / mar me dang / lha bshos dang rgyan la sogs ba dbul lo //
analyzed: mtha' mar sbyar pa'i sngags rnams kyis me tog dang / bdug sbos dang / mar me dang / lha bshos dang rgyan la sogs ba dbul lo //
translated: with these mantras one should offer flowers, incense, lamps, food offerings, ornaments, and so forth.

original: aom a'a: sarba sho dha na h'um phat /🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: aom a'a: sarba sho dha na h'um phat / ces pa ni /
translated: Oṃ āḥ sarva-śodhana Hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'bras bul sogs bdag par bya ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: 'bras bul sogs bdag par bya ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for consecrating the fruits and so forth.

original: aom badzra sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra svāhā.

original: zhes pa'i 'bras bus 'dren pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i 'bras bus 'dren pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for summoning the result.

original: de nas dam tshig gi rdzas byin la /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi rdzas byin la /
translated: Then, having given the pledge substances,🔽with the mantra Oṃ vajra āḥ,

original: aom badzra a'a:/ zhes pa'i sngags kyis me long bstan no //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a:/ zhes pa'i sngags kyis me long bstan no //
translated: show the mirror.

original: de nas sbyin sreg gis mnyes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg gis mnyes par bya ba ni /
translated: Then, pleasing with the burnt offering:

original: yon bdag gi 'byor ba'i bye brag gis lugs ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag la ste /
analyzed: yon bdag gi 'byor ba'i bye brag gis lugs ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi bye brag la ste /
translated: With the various particulars of the patron's wealth, there are various particulars of forms such as statues,

original: zhi ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi bar 'dod pa'i don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi bar 'dod pa'i don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: and so forth, up to the buddhas. The purpose is the desired goal.

original: gser gyi thur mas dngul la sogs pa'i snod du sbrang rtsi bzhag pa las blangs te /
analyzed: gser gyi thur mas dngul la sogs pa'i snod du sbrang rtsi bzhag pa las blangs te /
translated: Take honey from a golden spoon placed in a silver bowl, and so on,

original: aom tsakshu sa manta tsakshu ra bi sho dha ne sv'a h'a /🔽zhes brjod cing lugs ma'i spyan la byug cing dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom tsakshu sa manta tsakshu ra bi sho dha ne sv'a h'a / zhes brjod cing lugs ma'i spyan la byug cing dbye bar bya'o //
translated: and recite Oṃ cakṣuḥ samanta cakṣuḥ viśodhane svāhā.🔽Say that and anoint and open the eyes of the statue.

original: po ti la sogs pa rnams la me long gi gzugs brnyan la de ltar bya'o //
